0.title: Russian court bans Facebook and Instagram, classifies Meta as 'extremist'
0.article_body: A Russian court on Monday banned Facebook and Instagram in the country after classifying their parent company Meta Platforms as an "extremist" organisation. The ban does not include WhatsApp, Russia's TASS news agency reported. Russia had earlier blocked access to Instagram after Meta said it would allow Ukrainian users to post messages urging violence against Russian President Vladimir Putin.

1.title: Danish Siddiqui's parents to take legal action against Taliban over his death
1.article_body: Parents of photojournalist Danish Siddiqui, who was killed in Afghanistan last year during an assignment, will initiate legal action and move the International Criminal Court against the Taliban over Danish's death. Siddiqui was covering clashes between Afghan troops and the Taliban. "Danish was illegally detained, tortured and killed by the Taliban," said his family in a statement.

2.title: Putin must not win war in Ukraine: Estonian PM Kaja Kallas
2.article_body: Condemning the Russian invasion of Ukraine, Estonian PM Kaja Kallas has said that Russian President Vladimir Putin "must not win this war". Kallas, who termed Russia's actions "heartbreaking", stated that NATO countries are doing all they can to support Ukraine. Kallas added that NATO's strategy should focus on ending war by moving from a "deterrence posture" to a "defence posture".

3.title: Germany, United Arab Emirates sign climate-friendly energy deals
3.article_body: German Minister of Economics and Climate Protection Robert Habeck on Monday said German firms signed five agreements related to hydrogen research and development with companies from the United Arab Emirates (UAE). As per the ministry, German firms, Abu Dhabi National Oil Company and Japan's JERA will undertake a joint demonstration project for hydrogen transport.

4.title: ASEAN's special envoy begins trip to Myanmar, meets junta chief
4.article_body: A special envoy from ASEAN, Prak Sokhonn, met with Myanmar's junta chief Min Aung Hlaing on Monday during his mission to facilitate the start of a dialogue between the military and opponents of its coup. Prak and Hlaing discussed "the situation of protests and violence stemming from political disagreement", an official statement said. The envoy's visit will end on Wednesday.

5.title: Most Russian forces remain over 25 kilometres from centre of Kyiv: UK
5.article_body: UK Ministry of Defence on Monday said bulk of Russian forces remain more than 25 kilometres from centre of Ukrainian capital Kyiv. "Heavy fighting continues north of Kyiv," stated military intelligence update from the ministry. The ministry added that Kyiv remains Russia's primary military objective and they are likely to prioritise attempting to encircle the city over the coming weeks.

6.title: Late CDS Gen Bipin Rawat awarded Padma Vibhushan, his daughters receive honour
6.article_body: India's first Chief of Defence Staff (CDS) General Bipin Rawat, who died in a helicopter crash in December 2021, was awarded the Padma Vibhushan posthumously on Monday. His daughters Kritika and Tarini received the award from President Ram Nath Kovind on their father's behalf. General Rawat's wife and 12 others were also killed in the same crash.

7.title: Preparing for most exciting role of my life: Anil as Sonam announces pregnancy
7.article_body: After actress Sonam Kapoor shared pictures from her maternity shoot as a way of announcing her pregnancy, her father Anil Kapoor tweeted, "Now preparing for the most exciting role of my life- Grandfather!" He added, "Our lives will never be the same again...I couldn't be more grateful! Sonam, Anand you've made us happy beyond measure with this incredible news."

8.title: Shahid Afridi is my favourite player, after that Shaheen: Nida Dar
8.article_body: Pakistan Women all-rounder Nida Dar said Shahid Afridi and Shaheen Shah Afridi are her top two favourite players. "So I celebrate like them," she added. Nida registered 4/10 to help her side claim their first win in ongoing Women's World Cup after defeating West Indies. Notably, Nida is the first Pakistani cricketer, male or female, to bag 100 T20I wickets.

9.title: Not invited to Oscars: Best Picture nominee West Side Story's Rachel Zegler
9.article_body: Actress Rachel Zegler, who is the lead actress of Oscar's Best Picture nominee 'West Side Story', has revealed that she has not been invited to the ceremony. She had responded to a fan's comment about her outfit at the ceremony. A fan commented, "So not fair," while another wrote, "How’s the leading actress of a movie....up for seven...awards not invited?"

10.title: PhonePe acquires Pune-based micro-entrepreneur platform GigIndia
10.article_body: Walmart-owned PhonePe on Monday announced that it has acquired Pune-based GigIndia, a network for freelance micro-entrepreneurs. PhonePe did not reveal the financial details of the deal. As part of the acquisition, GigIndia will be integrated with the digital payments platform. GigIndia has 1.5 million entrepreneurs and over 100 enterprises as customers, the company said in its press release.

11.title: No fears of 'stagflation' in India: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das
11.article_body: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das said, "With regard to the prospect of stagflation, whether it is a risk for India, in our assessment I think such prospects don't exist." He added, "India is far away from such a grim prospect." 'Stagflation' is when there's slow economic growth and relatively high unemployment, which is at the same time accompanied by rising prices.

12.title: UP among 3 poorest states as per NITI Aayog’s ranking: Akhilesh
12.article_body: SP chief Akhilesh Yadav said under the BJP government, Uttar Pradesh is among the three poorest states in India as per NITI Aayog's multidimensional poverty index. "[UP] ranks third in terms of malnutrition rate," Yadav said. Adding that UP ranks last in the child and adolescent mortality rate category, he said, "These are the badges of failure of BJP government."

13.title: Indonesia ends quarantine requirement for international arrivals
13.article_body: Indonesia has removed its quarantine requirement for all international arrivals, Indonesian Tourism Minister Sandiaga Uno announced on Monday. The decision comes after a quarantine waiver for vaccinated visitors to the islands of Bali, Batam, and Bintan was implemented earlier this month. A negative RT-PCR test will still be required to enter the country, Uno added.

14.title: Andrew reacts to 'No Way Home' not getting Oscar best film nomination
14.article_body: After 'Spider-Man: No Way Home' did not receive an Oscar nomination in the Best Picture category, actor Andrew Garfield has said that he's "pretty satisfied" with the audience's response to the film. "I mean, it's the sixth biggest movie in the history of movies...I think that's plenty," he added. The film received an Oscar nomination in the Visual Effects category.

15.title: Smokes from wildfires can destroy Earth's ozone layer: Study
15.article_body: Canadian study stated that smokes from wildfires can destroy Earth's ozone layer. In its observations on Australian wildfires, lead author Peter Bernath said fires injected acidic smoke particles into stratosphere which converted ozone-regulating compounds into more reactive compounds that destroy ozone. Team used data from Canadian Space Agency's Atmospheric Chemistry Experiment (ACE) satellite.

16.title: Hyd Police give clean chit to TRS leader's son in accident case
16.article_body: Hyderabad Police have given clean chit to Telangana Rashtra Samithi's (TRS) Bodhan MLA Mohammed Shakir Amir’s son Raheel Amir in an accident case, which killed an infant last Thursday. Raheel's 19-year-old cousin Syed Afnan Ahmed was driving the car which hit street vendors in Jubilee Hills, police said. Police also ruled out possibility of Afnan driving under influence of alcohol.

17.title: Pramod Sawant to continue as Goa Chief Minister for 2nd term
17.article_body: Goa's caretaker CM Pramod Sawant has been chosen as the CM of the state for a second term, days after BJP won 20 seats in the 40-member Goa assembly. Notably, this will be the third straight term of the BJP in Goa. Reports suggest that the swearing-in ceremony of the new government will tentatively take place between March 23-25.

18.title: 'Lagaan' inspired me to make a story on human emotions: Rajamouli
18.article_body: Filmmaker SS Rajamouli has revealed that he was inspired by Aamir Khan-starrer 2001 film 'Lagaan' to make a story based on basic human emotions. "The way the entire country connected with 'Lagaan' made a big impression on me," he added. Rajamouli further said 'Lagaan' was the first film to be accepted across India and it was only made in Hindi.

19.title: Archaeologists discover 4,000-year-old ancient tombs in Egypt
19.article_body: Egyptian Ministry of Tourism and Antiquities on Saturday announced that archaeologists discovered five 4,000-year-old ancient tombs in Saqqara sites southwest of Cairo. As per the ministry, the tombs contained artefacts dating back to the Old Kingdom, a period spanning roughly from around 2700 BC to 2200 BC. The officials added that tombs belonged to regional rulers and palace supervisors.

20.title: Rachakonda Police to provide free police recruitment training
20.article_body: The official Twitter handle of Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police shared that the Commissioner of Police is planning to provide free police recruitment training to the poor, middle-class unemployed persons. The post further said that it will help them work hard to get jobs. "Staff...instructed to exercise restraint to set up free coaching centers as soon as...notification was issued," it added.

21.title: Hyd Police urges people to report drugs supply, sale information
21.article_body: Hyderabad Police on Monday took to Twitter to urge people to share any type of information regarding the supply, sale, transportation or cultivation of marijuana and other narcotics. The force shared the appeal with the caption, "Bury the drugs or [they'll] bury you soon." The post said the identity of the person who reports the information would be kept confidential.

22.title: EU Foreign Ministers discuss sanctions against Russian oil, gas
22.article_body: EU Foreign Ministers on Monday discussed imposing sanctions on Russian oil and gas sector. While ministers of Lithuania and Ireland said EU must impose sanctions against the Russian energy sector, countries such as Germany, Netherlands which are heavily dependent on Russian gas warned against an embargo on Russian energy imports. Notably, EU relies on Russia for 40% of its gas.

23.title: China is considering $2.5 bn in financial aid for Sri Lanka: Envoy
23.article_body: Qi Zhenhong, the Chinese Ambassador to Sri Lanka, on Monday said that China is considering a request for financial assistance from the South Asian nation. Sri Lanka has sought a $1 billion loan and a $1.5 billion credit line, he added. The request comes amid a severe economic crisis that has led to shortages of essential items in the country.

24.title: 'Race 1' was the best out of all films in the franchise: Bipasha
24.article_body: Actress Bipasha Basu said that the 2008 film 'Race' was the best film of the franchise. "It was an amazing thriller and Abbas-Mustan directing the film made it even better because they are excellent with thrillers," she added. This comes as the film completed 14 years of its release on Monday. "The energy on the sets was palpable," Bipasha stated.

25.title: After PMC & PCMC, Pune Zilla Parishad to come under state govt
25.article_body: After Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) and Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC), Pune Zilla Parishad will now come under the state government, as the tenure of the elected members ended on Sunday. "The tenure of the elected members ended on Sunday and now the state government would be in charge of the policy decisions," said Zilla Parishad CEO Ayush Prasad.

26.title: Pune man kills 24-yr-old wife for not bearing child, arrested
26.article_body: Pune Police have arrested a 30-year-old man who allegedly strangulated his 24-year-old wife to death for not bearing a child. The incident took place at the Vetalnagar area of Ambegaon Budruk on March 18. Police said the accused Devanand Kalel told them that his wife Kajal had died by suicide, however, the post-mortem revealed that it was murder.

27.title: Deeply shocked & saddened: PM after Chinese plane with 132 people crashes
27.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Monday took to Twitter after a Chinese plane with 132 passengers crashed into the mountains on Monday. He wrote, "Deeply shocked and saddened to learn about the crash of the passenger flight MU5735 with 132 on board in China’s Guangxi. Our thoughts and prayers are with the victims of the crash and their family members."

28.title: Chinese flight lost altitude very fast, descended steeply on vertical trajectory
28.article_body: The China Eastern Airlines flight carrying 132 people, that crashed in a mountainous area near the city of Wuzhou on Monday, lost altitude very fast, according to real-time flight tracking service Flightradar24. Radar tracking also showed that the Boeing 737 plane descended steeply on an almost vertical trajectory. The flight was travelling from Kunming to Guangzhou.

29.title: 20-yr-old Swiatek wins her 5th women's singles title, becomes world no. 2
29.article_body: Poland's Iga Swiatek defeated Greece's Maria Sakkari in straight sets to clinch the women's singles title at the Indian Wells on Sunday. With this win, the 20-year-old champion secured her fifth career title and moved up to the second spot in the world rankings. "It's pretty crazy because I wasn't expecting to be in...final," Swiatek said.

30.title: Pune’s St Mira’s College holds TEDx with theme ‘Magic of Risks’
30.article_body: Pune's St Mira's College for Girls hosted the third edition of TEDx after a long COVID-19 break. The theme for the event, which was organised by Sarah Kinariwala, mentored by Professor Abhradita Chatterjee Nahvi and supported by Principal In-charge Dr Jaya Rajagopalan, CWE co-ordinator Dr Rama Venkatachalam and Team CWE, was "Magic of Risks."

31.title: Venkatesh is a team man, always talks about winning: KKR skipper Shreyas
31.article_body: Praising Venkatesh Iyer, KKR captain Shreyas Iyer said the batter is a team man and always talks about winning. "That's the type of character we need in our team, one who is ready to go out there...show that relentlessness," he added. Talking about Venkatesh's batting spot in the team, Shreyas said that he's very flexible at any position.

32.title: If I'm home, nobody asks why I'm not at work: Shefali Shah on sexism
32.article_body: Actress Shefali Shah has revealed that if she is at home and hasn't gone to work, nobody asks her why she hasn't gone. "But...I...ask [my husband filmmaker Vipul Amrutlal Shah], 'Why are you not going to office today?'" she added. The actress further said that it has been years of conditioning that women stay home and husbands go to work.

33.title: Mumbai builder booked for continuing construction work after 10 pm
33.article_body: Mumbai-based Mahavir Developers has been reportedly booked for continuing construction work after 10 pm in violation of noise pollution norms. This comes after Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey issued strict noise pollution guidelines to infrastructure firms. According to guidelines, Bombay High Court orders are to be followed, including carrying out construction work only between 6 am to 10 pm.

34.title: Channi meets Punjab CM Mann in 1st meeting since Assembly polls
34.article_body: Former Punjab CM Charanjit Singh Channi met and congratulated the state's new CM Bhagwant Mann in Chandigarh on Monday. This is Channi's first meeting with CM Bhagwant Mann after the Assembly election results were announced on March 10. Channi lost the elections from both Assembly seats of Bhadaur and Chamkaur Sahib, where he had contested from.

35.title: Sanctions on Russia are like weapons of mass destruction: Raghuram Rajan
35.article_body: Sanctions imposed on Russia in the wake of the Russia-Ukraine war are like "weapons of mass destruction", former RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan said. "They may not topple buildings or collapse bridges but they destroy firms, financial institutions, livelihoods, and even lives," Rajan said. If not governed properly, sanctions could disturb the global financial order, he added.

36.title: Admission to DU's minority colleges might be based on CUET scores
36.article_body: Admissions to Delhi University's minority colleges, including St. Stephen's College and Jesus and Mary College, among others, could be based on the Common University Entrance Test (CUET) scores from the next academic year. Around 50% of the seats in various courses offered by minority colleges are reserved for students belonging to specific minority communities.

37.title: Glad to be part of new IPL team, build it from scratch: KL Rahul on LSG
37.article_body: KL Rahul, who will be leading Lucknow Super Giants in upcoming IPL after moving from Punjab Kings, said he's glad to be part of a new franchise and build it from scratch. "I have never sat in meetings discussing each and every player, how we want to set up the franchise...there is so much that has happened," he added.

38.title: 3 men stab man in neck in Gurugram after meeting him to end dispute
38.article_body: The Gurugram Police have booked three people for allegedly slitting the throat of a friend after a meeting to end an old dispute went wrong on Holi. According to the victim, he met the accused on Holi to resolve an old dispute. However, they had an argument again, following which Naresh (accused) stabbed him in the neck.

39.title: I'll be stupid not to do web series, finalising debut project: Daisy
39.article_body: Actress Daisy Shah has stated that the webspace has boomed amazingly, adding that she will be "really stupid" not to be open to doing a web series. "I've got a few offers. I'm still finalising on what I'll make my debut with," the actress said. Daisy added that web series have opened up a lot of job opportunities for everyone.

40.title: You've shown remarkable grit: PM Modi to Lakshya on All England silver
40.article_body: Following Indian shuttler Lakshya Sen's runner-up finish at 2022 All England Championships, PM Narendra Modi took to Twitter and wrote, "Proud of you Lakshya! You've shown remarkable grit and tenacity. He added, "You put up a spirited fight...I'm confident you'll keep scaling new heights of success." Sachin Tendulkar tweeted, "There're no failures in life. You either win or you learn,"

41.title: Manipur CM lists govt's 3 priorities after taking oath for 2nd term
41.article_body: Manipur CM N Biren Singh on Monday listed his government's three priorities after taking oath for his second consecutive term as Chief Minister. He said his government's "primary duty [is to] wash out corruption from the state". He added that his second and third priorities are to "wash out any kind of drug-related matter" and bring "insurgents...to the negotiating table".

42.title: Great Barrier Reef suffers bleaching due to ocean warming: Report
42.article_body: Climate Council, an Australian environmental group on Monday said the Great Barrier Reef is at risk of bleaching as ocean temperatures have increased by two to four degrees Celsius above average. Report added that the reef has suffered three mass bleaching events in past six years. This comes as a UN team is due to assess reef's World Heritage listing.

43.title: Deep-sea pipeline in Maharashtra's Palghar to be ready in 2 months
43.article_body: A deep-sea pipeline at Tarapur MIDC, being constructed to carry treated industrial effluents about 7 km away from high-tide line at Navapur beach in Maharashtra's Palghar district, will be operational within next two months, according to officials. The existing concrete pipeline that is operational since 1970s, suffers from frequent leaks, a Tarapur Environment Protection Society official said.

44.title: B'luru Traffic Police educates 2-wheeler riders about helmets
44.article_body: Bengaluru Traffic Police on Monday educated two-wheeler riders about wearing high-quality helmets. Pictures shared by the force show officers holding helmets and talking to the riders, while some riders posed with helmets provided by officers. The force also posted a video to raise awareness about helmets wherein it said that motorbike riders should wear a helmet bearing the ISI mark.

45.title: China Eastern Airlines' site turns black & white after crash as sign of respect
45.article_body: After the crash of its plane carrying 132 passengers, the website of  China Eastern Airlines turned black and white, a step airlines take in response to a crash as a sign of respect for the victims. The 737-800 aircraft crashed in southwest China on Monday, leading to a mountain fire while the number of casualties remain unknown.

46.title: Punjab Vidhan Sabha proceedings will now be telecast live: CM Mann
46.article_body: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann on Monday said proceedings of the state's Vidhan Sabha will now be telecast live. In his maiden address after Kultar Singh Sandhwan's unanimous election as the Vidhan Sabha Speaker, Mann said, "From now on, nobody will need to make a video without permission and face Privilege proceedings. The media will also get audio and videos."

47.title: Russian shelling kills at least 8 in Kyiv's Podil district: Report
47.article_body: Ukraine's Prosecutor General on Monday said at least eight were killed on Sunday in Kyiv's Podil district due to shelling by Russian forces. As per Kyiv Mayor Vitali Klitschko, several homes and a shopping mall were hit too. Meanwhile, UN said at least 902 civilians were killed and 1,459 others were injured in Ukraine from February 24 to March 19.

48.title: 13 NATO warships headed to Sweden amid bloc's drills in Norway: Report
48.article_body: As many as 13 warships from several NATO member countries were headed to Sweden's Frihamnen Port on Sunday amid bloc's "Cold Response 2022" military drills in Norway, Swedish media reported. The warships reportedly include nine German vessels. While the drills are being conducted amid Russia-Ukraine tensions, it was planned months prior and isn't related to the invasion, NATO has said.

49.title: China reports 2,027 new COVID-19 cases in last 24 hours
49.article_body: Chinese authorities said the country reported 2,027 new COVID-19 cases on Sunday, up from 1,737 from the previous day. As per China's National Health Commission, out of 2,027 cases, 1,947 were locally transmitted infections and 80 were imported ones. The authorities added that Jilin province recorded the highest number of infections with 1,542 cases.

50.title: Scientists find new form of ice that may be found on distant planets
50.article_body: US researchers discovered a new form of ice that may be found on moons and water-rich planets outside our solar system. The team squeezed the water sample between the tips of two diamonds and further subjected the resulting ice crystals to laser heating. Scientists observed the gradual transition from water to ice due to pressure raising and laser heating.

51.title: Pushkar Singh Dhami named as Uttarakhand CM
51.article_body: Uttarakhand's caretaker CM Pushkar Singh Dhami has been chosen as the new state CM after BJP won 47 seats in the 70-member Assembly in the recently-concluded elections. Dhami had lost the Khatima seat to Congress candidate Bhuwan Chandra Kapri, who won by a margin of over 6,500 votes. Dhami had earlier taken charge as CM in July 2021.

52.title: Spain welcomed 25,000 Ukrainian refugees so far: Migration Minister
52.article_body: Spanish Migration Minister José Luis Escrivá on Monday said that about 25,000 Ukrainian refugees have arrived in Spain since Russia launched its invasion on February 24. Around 9,000 of them have registered themselves with the Spanish authorities, he added. Many of the Ukrainians who have arrived are staying with relatives or friends, Escrivá further said.

53.title: I'm at fault: Real Madrid manager Ancelotti after 4-0 loss vs Barca
53.article_body: Following a 4-0 loss against Barcelona, Real Madrid manager Carlo Ancelotti said that his side was unrecognisable during the match and added everything went wrong for them. "We have to forget...and move forward, we have a big lead [in La Liga]. I...am at fault," he stated. Despite the loss, Real Madrid are on top of the La Liga points table.

54.title: 3 people selling 30 kg ivory tusks caught by police in Bengaluru
54.article_body: Three people selling ivory tusks weighing around 30 kgs were caught by police in Bengaluru. The arrests were reportedly made by the CK Acchukattu Police Station officers based on a tip-off. The tusks were believed to be of a well-grown 40 to 45-year-old elephant and were said to be worth ₹15-25 lakh per kg in the international market.

55.title: Video claims to show Chinese plane carrying 132 people 'nosedive' in final seconds
55.article_body: A video has surfaced on social media that claims to show the China Eastern Airlines aircraft carrying 132 people - 123 passengers and 9 crew - "nosedive" before crashing into the mountains. Earlier, flight tracking website FlightRadar24 showed that the plane descended steeply on an almost vertical trajectory. The Boeing 737 aircraft was travelling from Kunming to Guangzhou.

56.title: Kannada language exam must for Karnataka crime officer's post
56.article_body: Karnataka State Police Department has made the Secondary School Leaving Certificate (SSLC) Kannada language qualification mandatory for those applying for the Scene of Crime Office (SoCO) post. The decision was taken after candidates complained that there is no language requirement, allowing Karnataka residents to apply. The position requires applicants to have a forensic degree or diploma.

57.title: David Beckham hands Instagram account to Ukrainian doctor to raise awareness
57.article_body: David Beckham has handed control of his Instagram account with 71.6 million followers to a Ukrainian doctor. In a video posted on Sunday, Beckham said he wanted to highlight the "amazing work" of medical staff operating amid the Russian invasion. On Sunday, Dr Iryna, through Beckham's Stories, shared visuals of healthcare facilities being provided in a basement amid the war.

58.title: I'd love to come back as Aunt May, be part of multiverse: Marisa Tomei
58.article_body: Actress Marisa Tomei, who portrays Peter Parker's Aunt May in the 'Spider-Man' films, has said that she would love to make another appearance in Marvel films and be a part of the multiverse. Her character was killed in Tom Holland-starrer 'Spider-Man: No Way Home'. "May Parker hooks up with Ant-Man...There are more avenues to explore," Marisa added.

59.title: Maharashtra Min Nawab Malik's judicial custody extended till Apr 4
59.article_body: Maharashtra minister Nawab Malik's judicial custody has been extended till April 4 by the special PMLA (Prevention of Money Laundering Act) court on Monday. The court also allowed Malik to be provided with a bed, mattress, and chair during the period of custody. Notably, Malik was arrested in connection with a money laundering case related to fugitive gangster Dawood Ibrahim.

60.title: Loss in one crypto can't be set off against income in another one: Govt
60.article_body: Loss from the transfer of a virtual digital asset (VDA) will not be allowed to set off against income arising from transfer of another VDA, the Minister of State for Finance, Pankaj Chaudhary, told the Lok Sabha on Monday. He also clarified that infrastructure costs incurred in crypto mining won't be treated as cost of acquisition, but as capital expenditure.

61.title: Rishi Kapoor wasn't self-obsessed, he was cool & calm: Juhi Chawla
61.article_body: Actress Juhi Chawla has said that late veteran actor Rishi Kapoor was not self-obsessed like a lot of actors, adding that he was cool and calm. "There was no half-hearted take with him because he got the 'sur' (note) of his part," the actress added. She further said that when he looked his co-star in the eye, he wasn't acting.

62.title: Surat has soil, climate conditions similar to Mumbai: CSK's Fleming
62.article_body: Chennai Super Kings head coach Stephen Fleming said that his side is training in Surat because it offers similar red soil and climate conditions to Mumbai. "To have this ground to ourselves and be able to have open wickets and long net sessions have been...valuable," he stated. CSK will begin their IPL 2022 campaign against KKR on March 26.

63.title: China Eastern to ground all its Boeing 737-800 jets after recent crash: Report
63.article_body: After China Eastern Airlines Boeing 737- 800 with 132 people on board crashed on Monday, the airline has grounded all of its Boeing 737-800 passenger flights from Tuesday, reported Chinese media. China Eastern reportedly has 109 of the 737-800s in its fleet. China's airline industry has a good safety record, with its last major accident taking place 12 years ago.

64.title: World bows down to hard work: 19-yr-old Pradeep seen running at night in viral clip
64.article_body: Pradeep Mehra, who inspired many after filmmaker Vinod Kapri shared a video of him running in Noida at night, when asked to give a message to the world, said, "The world bows down to hard work." After the video went viral, Kapri said to the 19-year-old, "People from the Army also called. They want to speak with you."

65.title: Switzerland must freeze Russian oligarchs' assets, says Poland's PM
65.article_body: During a visit by Swiss President Ignazio Cassis to Poland on Monday, Polish PM Mateusz Morawiecki said that Switzerland must freeze accounts of Russian oligarchs in the country and confiscate their assets. In response, Cassis said that Switzerland had adopted European Union sanctions against hundreds of people, including many oligarchs. Western countries have imposed numerous sanctions on Russia.

66.title: AIMIM is working at the behest of BJP: Mallikarjun Kharge
66.article_body: Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge has accused AIMIM of working at the behest of BJP and has rejected any possibilities of an alliance with the Asaduddin Owaisi-led political outfit. "Congress has not received any proposal (of an alliance)," Kharge said. He added that "there is a need to be cautious of such parties which attempt to defeat secular parties".

67.title: Junior Artistes said 'Bharat Mata ki jai' after each take: 'The Kashmir...' actor
67.article_body: 'The Kashmir Files' actor Chinmay Mandlekar said junior artistes in the film said 'Bharat Mata ki Jai' after each take during the shooting of a mob scene that involved raising anti-India slogans. "They started saying that 'we'll not do work in such a film'," he said. "So after every take, I [also] started saying 'Bharat Mata ki jai'," he added.

68.title: Coach Ponting addresses squad ahead of IPL 2022, DC share video
68.article_body: DC have shared a video in which head coach Ricky Ponting can be seen addressing the squad for the first time ahead of the IPL season. "This tournament for me is not just about the players and the coaches...What we try and create...is a family environment," said Ponting. DC will play their first match against MI on March 27.

69.title: Who holds the record for playing the most deliveries in a Test match?
69.article_body: Late England batter Walter Reginald Hammond holds the record for playing the most deliveries in a Test. He faced a total of 977 deliveries to set the record in a Test against Australia in 1929. He is followed by Herbert Sutcliffe (871 deliveries), Leonard Hutton (847), Glenn Turner (759), Robert Simpson (749), Geoffrey Boycott (725) and Mark Taylor (723).

70.title: Madhuri, Jackie recreate song 'Sun Beliya' from film 100 Days, share video
70.article_body: Actress Madhuri Dixit recreated her song 'Sun Beliya' from 1991 film '100 Days' along with actor Jackie Shroff. Taking to Instagram, Madhuri shared a reel, dancing with Jackie Shroff and captioned it, "Had a great time creating a reel with this peppy number from '100 Days' with @apnabhidu. Totally lit up the set." The duo had previously worked in 'Khalnayak'.

71.title: 6 arrested in murder of Puri Jagannath temple servitor
71.article_body: The Odisha police arrested six persons in connection with the murder of a servitor of the Puri Jagannath temple. The victim, Krushna Chandra Pratihari, was shot in the head and chest by two persons outside a gym last week. "As per our preliminary investigation, it seems to be a revenge killing. We are also investigating a land deal," said police.

72.title: LIC files updated IPO prospectus with Q3 results: Reports
72.article_body: LIC has filed an updated draft red herring prospectus (DRHP) with market regulator SEBI for its upcoming IPO, PTI reported. The updated DRHP includes LIC's Q3 FY22 financials. LIC had earlier filed its draft papers with SEBI in February. According to reports, the LIC IPO, earlier scheduled for March, was postponed to mid-May due to rising market volatility.

73.title: Jhunjhunwala purchased 12 apartments for ₹371 crore to build his new home: Report
73.article_body: Billionaire Rakesh Jhunjhunwala bought 12 apartments in Ridgeway Apartments Malabar Hill to build his new multi-storey home currently being built in Mumbai, Moneycontrol reported. He paid ₹176 crore in 2013 for the first six apartments and ₹195 crore in 2017 for the next six. Jhunjhunwala's new home will spread across 70,000 square feet and will also have a banquet hall.

74.title: UN chief warns against 'addiction to fossil fuels' amid Russia crisis
74.article_body: UN chief Antonio Guterres has warned that countries finding alternatives to fossil fuel supplies from Russia, which is facing sanctions, could hinder climate goals. "Countries could become so consumed by the immediate fossil fuel supply gap that they neglect or knee-cap policies to cut fossil fuel use," said Guterres. "Addiction to fossil fuels is mutually assured destruction," he added.

75.title: Was a big deal for me to get picked by CSK in IPL mega auction: Dube
75.article_body: Shivam Dube said it was big deal for him to get picked by Chennai Super Kings in the IPL 2022 mega auction. Dube revealed he had a word with MS Dhoni recently where the latter asked Dube to do a few things. "I told him I'll...do justice. When Mahi bhai asks you to do something, consider it done," he added.

76.title: CSK have two options: Irfan Pathan on Faf du Plessis' replacement
76.article_body: Ex-India all-rounder Irfan Pathan said Devon Conway or Robin Uthappa could fill in Faf Du Plessis' spot in Chennai Super Kings' batting order in IPL 2022. "They've two options...Wankhede and CCI are good pitches, the ones you play in overseas, Conway looks very comfortable in that," Pathan said. "If Conway doesn't play...Uthappa opens...you'll get...to play Maheesh Theekshana," he added.

77.title: Winning and losing part of game, he gave his best: Lakshya Sen's mother
77.article_body: Indian badminton player Lakshya Sen's mother Nirmala Sen praised her son's performance after he clinched silver medal at All England Open Badminton Championships 2022 on Sunday. "Winning and losing are part of the game. Lakshya gave his best and becoming runner-up is a big achievement considering his age (20)," said Nirmala. "I'm confident of Lakshya making a comeback," she added.

78.title: Gurugram Police arrest 3 people for cheating e-commerce firm
78.article_body: Gurugram Police on Sunday said that they have arrested three people, including a delivery partner, for cheating an e-commerce company. The accused would order laptops and place orders to return them alleging that they were defective, they added. However, they would remove the laptops and fill the box with A4 sheets before sending them back, the police further said.

79.title: We stopped feeling normal: KL Rahul on bio-bubbles
79.article_body: Talking about bio-bubbles during cricket tours amid the pandemic, KL Rahul said, "I was quite okay initially, but I think the last series and the West Indies series at home really got to me." He added, "You need your family, your friends to just feel normal. We stopped feeling normal. We had to sleep, wake-up, go to the ground."

80.title: Steve Smith gets angry due to buggy camera, video goes viral
80.article_body: Australia vice-captain Steve Smith got angry after being distracted by a buggy camera while batting in the first innings of the third Test against Pakistan in Lahore. A video has gone viral showing Smith gesturing towards the camera at the midwicket boundary. "One thing is for sure, Smith has the best peripheral vision," the commentator said.

81.title: Indian origin woman killed in student flat in London, Tunisian national arrested
81.article_body: Scotland Yard have arrested a 22-year-old Tunisian national after a 19-year-old Indian origin British woman was found allegedly murdered in her student accommodation in London. The victim Sabita Thanwani had been in a relationship with the accused Maher Maaroufe, said the Metropolitan Police. Thanwani was found with serious injuries to the neck and was pronounced dead at the scene.

82.title: It's better not to say anything about Dhoni, he's one-man army: Saba Karim
82.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Saba Karim has said it's better not to speculate whether IPL 2022 will be MS Dhoni's last or not. "How many matches will he play, how many more years will he play, it's very difficult to say...because he's a player who's a one-man army," he stated. "We will have to wait this season at least," Karim added.

83.title: IPL is the biggest domestic tournament in the world: Sam Billings
83.article_body: Kolkata Knight Riders' Sam Billings has said that IPL is the biggest domestic tournament in the world. "It's my sixth year and absolutely love playing over here in India...It's an honour to play here," Billings added. KKR bought the wicketkeeper-batsman for ₹2 crore in the IPL 2022 mega auction. The 30-year-old has previously played for CSK and DC.

84.title: Ola Electric invests in Israeli battery tech firm StoreDot
84.article_body: Ola Electric has invested in Israeli battery technology firm StoreDot, a pioneer in batteries with extreme fast charging (XFC) technology, Ola CEO Bhavish Aggarwal said. The investment will give Ola Electric access to the XFC technology that charges batteries from 0 to 100% in five minutes. Ola will also have exclusive rights to manufacture batteries with XFC technology in India.

85.title: How was Cyclone Asani named and what does it mean?
85.article_body: Expected to form over Andaman and Nicobar Islands on Monday evening, Cyclone Asani is the year's first cyclone and the first to form in the month of March. Named by Sri Lanka, it means 'wrath' in Sinhala, one of their official languages. As per a list by IMD in 2020, it was Sri Lanka's turn to pick a name.

86.title: Jhunjhunwala's multi-storey mansion to have living room larger than 3BHK: Report
86.article_body: Billionaire Rakesh Jhunjhunwala's 70,000 sq ft multi-storey Mumbai residence will have living and dining rooms larger than the size of 3BHK apartments in luxury projects, Moneycontrol reported. "His master bedroom of 731 square feet is 20% bigger than the average 2BHK," it added. The 4th floor will have a banquet hall and the 10th floor will have four guest bedrooms.

87.title: Looking forward to playing alongside Rashid Khan in IPL 2022: Tewatia
87.article_body: Rahul Tewatia, who will be playing for Gujarat Titans in the IPL 2022, said that he's looking forward to sharing the dressing room and playing alongside Afghanistan's Rashid Khan. "Rashid is a mystery bowler so will try to add a little mystery in my bowling," Tewatia added. The all-rounder was bought by Gujarat for ₹9 crore in the mega auction.

88.title: NZ Women assistant coach Oram leaves Women's World Cup midway
88.article_body: New Zealand Women assistant coach Jacob Oram left the squad in the middle of the ongoing ICC Women's World Cup on Monday. The former cricketer had to leave after learning that his family members have tested COVID-19 positive. The White Ferns have won just two out of their six games and are currently placed sixth on the points table.

89.title: Govt considering measures to reduce medical fees in state: K'taka CM
89.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said the government is considering measures to reduce fees for medical course in the state. He added that the NMC is looking into it, following the Ukraine crisis to facilitate more students to study here. He added, the Centre is considering alternative measures for medical students, who have returned from Ukraine, before completing their course.

90.title: I'm staying as 'ghar jamai' at her house: Ankita Lokhande's husband Vicky Jain
90.article_body: Television actress Ankita Lokhande's husband Vicky Jain said he is living at Ankita's house as 'ghar jamai'. "We had bought a flat and repairing work, renovation and everything couldn't be completed on time because of pandemic. It got delayed...and is still pending so we couldn't shift to new house...Whenever I visit Mumbai I've been staying at Ankita's house, he added.

91.title: Proud: Karan as PM Modi inspects antiquities repatriated to India from Australia
91.article_body: Ahead of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's virtual summit with his Australian counterpart Scott Morrison on Monday, Australia handed over around 29 antiquities to India. Taking to Twitter,  Filmmaker Karan Johar retweeted a video of PM Modi examining the antiquities and wrote, "News that'll fill every Indian's heart with utmost pride @narendramodi. 29 antiquities repatriated to India from Australia."

92.title: No re-exams for students who were absent due to hijab protest in K'taka
92.article_body: The Karnataka government said that no re-examinations will be held for students who missed the second PUC exams 2022 while participating in hijab protests. Karnataka Education Minister BC Nagesh said providing the students a second opportunity was "impossible". "We won't create a precedent by holding re-exams for absentees. They can appear for supplementary exams like everyone else," he added.

93.title: N Biren Singh takes oath as Manipur CM; 5 MLAs sworn in as Cabinet ministers
93.article_body: N Biren Singh on Monday took oath as the Chief Minister of Manipur, for the second term. Singh was administered the oath of office by Manipur Governor La Ganesan at Raj Bhavan in Imphal. Five MLAs, including Nemcha Kipgen, Yumnam Khemchand Singh, Thongam Biswajit Singh, Awangbou Newmai and Govindas Konthoujam, were also sworn in as Cabinet ministers of the state.

94.title: Numbers are part of journey not destination: Ashwin on 442 Test wickets
94.article_body: Ravichandran Ashwin, who recently became India's second highest wicket-taker in Tests after he surpassed Kapil Dev's tally of 434 wickets, said it's humbling to see what he's been able to do in terms of numbers. The off-spinner added that numbers are a part of journey rather than the destination. Ashwin has taken 442 wickets from 86 Tests so far.

95.title: No proposal from RBI on crypto trading mechanism yet: Govt
95.article_body: Minister of State for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary on Monday said the RBI has not yet proposed any mechanism for the trading of crypto assets. He said the cryptocurrency sector's legal framework "may be finalised only after all aspects are carefully examined". Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman had earlier proposed a 30% tax on income earned from crypto transactions in Budget 2022.

96.title: BJP announces 6 more names, completes list for all 36 UP MLC seats
96.article_body: After announcing candidates on 30 seats, BJP has now announced candidates on six more seats for the upcoming UP Legislative Council elections in which 36 MLC seats will be contested. The BJP's list comprises of several defectors including those from BSP, SP and Congress. Currently, BJP has 35 MLCs while SP has 17 MLCs in the 100-member UP Legislative Council.

97.title: Mandeep Singh's last-minute goal helps India beat Argentina 4-3
97.article_body: Striker Mandeep Singh's last-minute goal helped India beat Argentina by 4-3 in the FIH Pro League match in Bhubaneswar on Sunday. Argentina were trailing 0-2 at half-time but the 2016 Olympic champion managed to equalise in the final quarter until Mandeep scored with just 26 seconds remaining. Defender Varun Kumar was named the 'Player of the Match' for his performance.

98.title: B'luru zoo holds awareness session to mark World Sparrow Day
98.article_body: Bengaluru Bannerghatta Biological Park tweeted on Sunday that it held an awareness session for visitors to mark World Sparrow Day and Global Recycling Day. The awareness session was about the ecological importance of sparrows and the threats and ways to conserve them by recycling items and creating nest boxes, feeders and water troughs, the zoo said.

99.title: Will try to better my 2nd inning of politics: Supriyo on Bengal by-polls
99.article_body: Ahead of West Bengal Assembly by-elections, Trinamool Congress (TMC) leader Babul Supriyo said on Monday that he'll try to better his "second inning of politics". Supriyo, who is TMC's candidate from the Ballygunge seat, filed his nomination for the polls today. Supriyo had resigned as Union Minister and BJP's MP from Asansol in 2021 citing "politics of hatred" as reason.

100.title: Delhi's Pragati Maidan corridor to be opened in a month: Deputy CM
100.article_body: The Pragati Maidan road corridor and tunnel project is almost complete and will open in a month, Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said on Monday. After reviewing the project's progress, Sisodia tweeted, "This corridor will soon ease traffic in and around Ring Road and India Gate." Under the project, Delhi's PWD is constructing a 1.2-km-long tunnel and six underpasses.

101.title: Temple idol in Noida vandalised, police launch probe
101.article_body: The police said that an idol in a temple in Noida's Behlolpur village was found vandalised on Monday morning. "A police team along with forensic experts and a dog squad reached the site to look into the matter immediately," a senior police officer said. "Some blood samples were...found there which prima facie look like human blood," the officer added.

102.title: Kraigg Brathwaite breaks record for playing most deliveries in a Test by a West Indian
102.article_body: West Indies captain Kraigg Brathwaite has broken the record for playing most deliveries in a Test match by a West Indian. The 29-year-old played a total of 673 deliveries in the second Test against England in Barbados. He surpassed the previous record of 582 deliveries set by Brian Lara against England in 2004.

103.title: Hyd Police to organise job fair on Mar 26; 30 companies to participate
103.article_body: Hyderabad Police will organise a 'Mega Job Mela' on March 26, the official Twitter handle of Banjara Hills SHO tweeted on Saturday. The job fair will be held from 9:30 am onwards at the Sri Kotla Vijaya Bhaskar Reddy Stadium. As many as 30 companies, including ICICI Bank, will participate in the event to recruit over 3,000 people, police added.

104.title: Told govt 'don't repeal farm laws, it'd be unfair to majority': SC panel member
104.article_body: Anil Ghanwat, who was part of the SC-appointed panel examining the farm laws, has said the committee advised the government against repealing the laws. The repeal would be unfair to the 'silent' (not part of protest) majority of farmers who support the laws, the panel told the government according to Ghanwat. Most farmers' organisations consulted, supported the laws, he revealed.

105.title: China to send additional aid worth nearly ₹12 crore to Ukraine
105.article_body: Chinese Red Cross will offer an additional humanitarian aid worth 10 million yuan (nearly ₹12 crore) to Ukraine amid its conflict with Russia, Foreign Ministry spokesperson Wang Wenbin said on Monday. This takes aid pledged by China to Ukraine to 15 million yuan (nearly ₹18 crore). Earlier, UN said that 902 civilians have been killed in Ukraine since February 24.

106.title: His leg-side play, flicks are wonderful: Sangakkara on RR's Padikkal
106.article_body: Asked about any aspect of game he'd like to have from Devdutt Padikkal, RR Director of Cricket Kumar Sangakkara said the batter's leg-side play and flicks are wonderful. "He's such an exciting player, so accomplished. I just want him to know how valuable he is for...team" he added. Padikkal was bought by RR for ₹7.75 crore in mega auction 2022.

107.title: He is Aatmanirbhar: Anand Mahindra on 19-year-old's midnight run in Noida
107.article_body: Sharing the viral video of a 19-year-old man running in Noida at midnight, Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra said, "He is Aatmanirbhar!" While he refused a lift offered by filmmaker Vinod Kapri, Mahindra wrote, "This is indeed inspiring. But you know what my Monday Motivation is? The fact that he is so independent and refuses the offer of a ride."

108.title: I don't belong here, I don't belong there: Afghanistan's ex-FM driving Uber in US
108.article_body: Khalid Payenda, who resigned as Afghanistan's Finance Minister as the Taliban took over the country in August 2021, is now working as an Uber driver in the US, The Washington Post reported. "Right now, I don't have any place. I don't belong here and I don't belong there," Payenda said. He also works as an adjunct professor at Georgetown University.

109.title: Renault resumes production at Moscow plant
109.article_body: French automobile manufacturer Renault has resumed production at its plant in Moscow. Renault suspended operations at its car assembly plant in Moscow in late February due to logistics bottlenecks that caused component shortages. According to ratings agency Fitch, Renault generated 10% of its revenue and around 12% of its operating profit margin in the country in 2021.

110.title: We're helpless: Medical student back from China on training recognition
110.article_body: Murshid Aleen, an Indian student studying MBBS in a Chinese university, who came back in 2020 spoke about physical training in India. "It's been two years since we have been attending online classes...Most of us are doing are practicals at various government and private hospitals in Kerala, but is not recognised...we are helpless right now," Aleen said.

111.title: 61 of 73 farmers' bodies consulted fully supported farm laws: SC panel report
111.article_body: A member of the SC-appointed panel on the farm laws has said that 61 of 73 farmers' organisations (representing over 3.83 crore farmers) interviewed, fully supported the repealed laws. Making details of the panel's report public, Anil Ghanwat said protesting farmers didn't engage with the panel. MSP played no role in the lives of farmers who were consulted, he added.

112.title: Nadda arrives in Imphal ahead of N Biren Singh's oath taking ceremony
112.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda arrived in Imphal on Monday, ahead of the swearing-in ceremony of Manipur CM- designate N Biren Singh. He is going to be the CM of Manipur for the second time, the BJP announced on Sunday. Singh was unanimously elected as the CM in the Manipur BJP legislature party meeting in Imphal.

113.title: Startups get up to 10 years for converting debt investment into equity
113.article_body: The government has extended the timeline for startups to convert debt investment made in the company into equity shares to 10 years, according to a press note by DPIIT. Startups previously had up to 5 years to convert their debt investment into equity effective from the day of issuance of convertible note.

114.title: 3 CRPF personnel injured as Maoists attack security camp in Chhattisgarh
114.article_body: Three Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) personnel sustained injuries after Maoists allegedly opened fire at a security camp in Chhattisgarh's Sukma district using country-made weapons, police said. The injured personnel are stable and have been airlifted to Raipur for better treatment, Bastar Inspector General of Police said. The Maoists also allegedly hurled locally-made grenades, police added.

115.title: Retired General offers to help 19-yr-old get into Army after his viral running video
115.article_body: Reacting to the video of a 19-year-old man running in Noida at midnight, a Retired Army General offered his help. In reference to his wish to join the Army, Lt General Satish Dua tweeted, "To help him pass the recruitment tests on his merit, I've interacted with Colonel of Kumaon Regiment...He's doing the needful to train the boy for recruitment."

116.title: Bombay HC rejects plea to stay OTT release of Ranveer Singh's '83'
116.article_body: The Bombay High Court has rejected Mad Man Film Ventures' plea against the makers of Ranveer Singh-starrer '83' to stay its release on OTT platforms. The plea had alleged copyright infringement, adding that Mad Man had not granted its consent to the platforms to broadcast the film. The court however upheld the exploitation rights of Reliance Entertainment Studios Pvt Ltd.

117.title: Kissed my friend while I was married to Karan; got attracted to him: Nisha
117.article_body: 'Lock Upp' contestant, Nisha Rawal revealed on the show that she had kissed another man while she was married to her ex-husband Karan Mehra. Nisha said, "I met an old friend...I confided in him about...lot of things apart from the abusive past." "I...got attracted to him...I kissed that person. [But] I confessed [to Karan] that day itself," she added.

118.title: Australia name Daniel Vettori as spin consultant for ODIs, T20I vs Pak
118.article_body: Former New Zealand captain Daniel Vettori has been appointed as Australia's spin consultant for the white-ball leg of their ongoing series against Pakistan. Australia are currently playing their third and final Test against Pakistan in Lahore, which will be followed by a three-match ODI series, beginning on March 29. Australia will also play a lone T20I on April 5.

119.title: Examining educational concerns of evacuated students from Ukraine: Centre to SC
119.article_body: The Central government on Monday told the Supreme Court that the Government of India has evacuated 22,500 students from Ukraine and it is also looking into their educational concerns. "A mammoth task has been completed," the Attorney General of India, KK Venugopal, told the apex court. The apex court then closed the two petitions pending before it on the issue.

120.title: US to declare Rohingya repression in Myanmar a 'genocide': Officials
120.article_body: The US is set to declare the violence committed on the Rohingya Muslims by the Myanmar military a 'genocide' on Monday, officials have said. This comes as Myanmar is already facing accusations of genocide at the International Court of Justice (ICJ). Myanmar military began a crackdown on Rohingya community in 2017, reportedly forcing over 7,00,000 people to flee the country.

121.title: Have met kids who saw their parents being murdered: Pallavi on 'The Kashmir..'
121.article_body: Actress Pallavi Joshi said that she and husband Vivek Agnihotri researched for 'The Kashmir Files' for more than four years. "We went to...USA, UK, Germany, Singapore, Jammu and Kashmir, Pune, Thailand, Delhi...wherever we could find first family of the victim...whose father was murdered, whose mother was raped, children who saw their parents being murdered...We have met those people," she added.

122.title: Siddhant and I are good friends, I call us Tom and Jerry: Ananya
122.article_body: Actress Ananya Panday in an interview has revealed that she is good friends with actor and 'Gehraiyaan' co-star Siddhant Chaturvedi. "I call us Tom and Jerry because we fight a lot," the actress added. In a 2020 interview, Siddhant had responded to Ananya talking about the struggles she faced in Bollywood saying, "Their struggle begins where our dreams come true."

123.title: What's the case involving 'Child Q', the 15-yr-old Black girl strip-searched in London?
123.article_body: A 15-year-old Black girl was strip-searched while she was menstruating at her school in London by police officers after she was wrongly suspected of carrying drugs. The incident which took place in 2020 has come to light this month. Thousands of people took part in protests in London in support of the girl, who is now known as 'Child Q'.

124.title: Is it against my job to be educated: Nakuul on article on actors' qualifications
124.article_body: Actor Nakuul Mehta on Monday shared an article titled 'Educational qualifications of...actors will leave you stunned'. He wrote, "Why must it leave you stunned? Does it go against my job to be educated?" Actress Nikita Dutta replied to his tweet writing, "Educated no. But well-read yes," while journalist Surbhi Dutta wrote, "It shows...society's mindset and how it looks at showbiz."

125.title: Saffron flag may become national flag if Hindus unite: RSS leader
125.article_body: RSS leader Kalladka Prabhakar Bhat said if Hindus unite, the "Bhagwa Dwaj" (saffron flag) may become the national flag. "It can and should happen if Hindu Samaj comes together," Bhat said. "If a majority of people vote in Parliament and Rajya Sabha in favour of changing the National Flag, then the flag can be changed," Bhat stated.

126.title: 3,677 traffic e-challans issued in GB Nagar on Sunday: Police
126.article_body: Traffic police in Gautam Buddha Nagar on Sunday issued 3,677 e-challans to vehicle owners for various violations, officials said. This was part of a special campaign carried out by the police in the district. "During the campaign, police officials were deployed at all intersections and other important locations where they checked the offenders," a police spokesperson said.

127.title: Zelenskyy praises Mila Kunis & Ashton Kutcher after they raise $35 mn for Ukraine
127.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Monday thanked Hollywood couple Ashton Kutcher and Mila Kunis, who have been able to collect over $35 million for Ukraine through their fundraiser. Zelenskyy shared a picture of the three of them on a video call and wrote, "They inspire the world." Mila Kunis was born in Chernivtsi in Ukraine.

128.title: 3 siblings killed, 1 injured as dilapidated house collapses in Gujarat
128.article_body: Three siblings died and their 18-year-old sister sustained injuries when their house collapsed in Gujarat's Bharuch on Monday, police said. The single-storey dilapidated house caved in while the children's parents were away at work. The four children were pulled out from under the rubble by fire brigade personnel and taken to a hospital, where three of them were pronounced dead.

129.title: PSG lose 0-3, suffer their worst defeat against Monaco in 23 years
129.article_body: Ligue 1 leaders Paris Saint-Germain (PSG) were beaten 0-3 by Monaco, with forward Wissam Ben Yedder scoring two goals. This was Monaco's biggest league win against PSG since 1999, according to Ligue 1 statistics. Notably, PSG took the field on Sunday without Lionel Messi and Sergio Ramos. PSG are placed top of the Ligue 1 table with nine matches remaining.

130.title: Leopard sighted at Mercedes-Benz India campus in Pune, employees evacuated
130.article_body: A leopard was sighted on the campus of Mercedes-Benz India in Pune on Monday, following which, employees were evacuated to a safe spot. The leopard was rescued by forest department officials with the help of local police. Reports said that the leopard will soon be taken to a transit facility in Junnar.

131.title: Musk's Starlink helping Ukrainian drone unit destroy Russian tanks at night
131.article_body: Billionaire Elon Musk-led SpaceX's Starlink system is helping a Ukrainian drone unit destroy Russian tanks and command trucks. "If we use a drone with thermal vision at night, the drone must connect through Starlink to the artillery guy and create target acquisition," the unit's leader told The Times. Starlink ensures the teams can work even during internet or power outages.

132.title: Video shows fire in Chinese mountains where flight with 133 passengers crashed
132.article_body: A video has shown fire breaking out in the mountains in China where a China Eastern Airlines flight carrying 133 passengers crashed on Monday. Flight MU5735 got lost during its route from Kunming to Guangzhou, reported China's state-affiliated ShanghaiEye. The jet involved in the accident was a Boeing 737 aircraft and the number of casualties wasn't immediately known, Reuters reported.

133.title: 'The Kashmir..' reveals inhuman horror of religious bigotry: UP CM
133.article_body: Uttar Pradesh caretaker Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath took to Twitter to share a picture with the team of 'The Kashmir Files'. "The film The Kashmir Files boldly reveals the inhuman horror of religious bigotry and terrorism. Undoubtedly, this film will work to make society and country aware. Congratulations to entire team for producing such a thought-provoking film," the tweet read.

134.title: Maha to probe alleged funds misuse under former BJP govt's scheme
134.article_body: Maharashtra Women and Child Development Minister Yashomati Thakur said on Monday that the state government will be setting up a committee to probe the alleged misappropriation of state funds under the 'Prajwala' scheme of the previous BJP government. Thakur said this in the state Legislative Council following a calling to attention notice by Shiv Sena leader Manisha Kayande.

135.title: 2 Pak lawmakers booked for protesting against dissident party member
135.article_body: Two provincial lawmakers of Pakistan PM Imran Khan-led PTI have been booked for protesting outside the residence of the party's dissident national assembly member Ramesh Kumar Vankwani in Karachi. An FIR was registered against Shah Nawaz Jadoon, Saeed Ullah Afridi and several other party members. This comes days ahead of the no-confidence motion against PM Khan.

136.title: It was a tough call: Rahul on leaving PBKS after IPL 2021
136.article_body: LSG's newly-appointed captain KL Rahul has opened on leaving PBKS after four years, stating that it was a tough call but he wanted to see if there's a "new journey" for him. "Wanted to see what's in store for me...I've been attached to Punjab for a long time...[but] I wanted to see if I can do something else," Rahul explained.

137.title: I work at McD in Noida, run 10 km every night to join Army: 19-yr-old in viral video
137.article_body: Pradeep Mehra, the 19-year-old youth whose video of running in the midnight in Noida went viral after being shared by filmmaker Vinod Kapri, said that he does so as he wants to "join the Army". Mehra, who works at Noida Sector-16's McDonald's, runs from his work to Barola every night, covering 10 kilometres. He rejected Kapri's offer for a lift.

138.title: BJP MP gives Zero Hour notice in Rajya Sabha demanding Uniform Civil Code
138.article_body: BJP MP Harnath Singh Yadav on Monday submitted a Zero Hour notice in Rajya Sabha demanding the implementation of Uniform Civil Code (UCC) in the country. Notably, the party had promised to bring UCC in Uttarakhand ahead of the assembly elections. Months ago, the Centre had told Delhi High Court that there is no immediate plan to implement UCC.

139.title: Video shows Tesla jumping 50 ft in air before crashing during a stunt in US
139.article_body: The Los Angeles police shared a video of a Tesla car speeding and flying 50 ft in the air before it crashed into parked cars and trash cans. It was reportedly driven by a rental driver, who was performing a stunt at a meet-up of Tesla users. The police have announced a reward of $1,000 for information about the driver.

140.title: Words 'f***ing' & 'b**ch' removed from Telugu version of RRR: Reports
140.article_body: The pan-India film 'RRR', starring actors Ram Charan and Jr NTR, reportedly had to undergo several cuts, days ahead of its release. According to reports, the Telugu version of 'RRR' has been granted a U/A certificate with three audio cuts. The abusive words like 'f***ing* and 'b**ch' were asked to be removed by the Central Board of Film Certification (CBFC).

141.title: Challenges like pandemic, war make it important for India to be self-reliant: PM
141.article_body: PM Narendra Modi has said challenges faced by the world like the Russia-Ukraine war and the COVID-19 pandemic make it all the more important for India to become self-reliant. "In today's world, it is difficult to estimate when and what will happen and how it will affect us," PM Modi added. He also highlighted the importance of 'Aatmanirbhar Bharat'.

142.title: Roped in Alia as 'Sita' because we wanted a girl with inner strength: Rajamouli
142.article_body: Speaking about Alia's role as 'Sita' in RRR, filmmaker SS Rajamouli said it's not a full-fledged character but an important cameo. "We wanted a soft, fragile-looking girl but who also has enough inner strength...This is why I wanted Alia to do this role," he added. "The length of character [is] less but the importance of the character is...high," he said.

143.title: TMC MP Abhishek Banerjee appears before ED in Delhi in coal scam case
143.article_body: TMC MP Abhishek Banerjee was on Monday questioned by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) at its Delhi office in connection with the coal scam case. Banerjee reached the central probe agency's office at around 11 am today. He was earlier questioned in this case in September. The ED has also summoned his wife, Rujira.

144.title: Plane carrying 133 passengers crashes in China, casualties unknown: Reports
144.article_body: A China Eastern Airlines aircraft carrying 133 passengers from Kunming to Guangzhou crashed in Guangxi on Monday, AFP and Reuters reported. The reports quoting Chinese media said that the number of casualties is unknown. Reuters reported that the plane, a Boeing 737 aircraft, had an "accident" in the region of Guangxi and caused a fire in the mountains.

145.title: 37 die after consuming spurious liquor in Bihar since Holi
145.article_body: About 37 people have died after allegedly consuming spurious liquor in Bihar's Bhagalpur, Banka and Madhepura since Holi, according to an official of state police. However, police claimed that they're "mysterious deaths" and probe is ongoing to determine the actual cause. Two persons died due to an ailment and heart attack respectively, as per their families, Bhagalpur District Magistrate said.

146.title: B'desh pacer Taskin Ahmed likely to join LSG as Mark Wood's replacement
146.article_body: LSG are likely to sign Bangladesh pacer Taskin Ahmed as Mark Wood's replacement for the upcoming IPL season. Wood, who was bought by LSG for ₹7.5 crore in the auction, was ruled out of the tournament after suffering an injury on his right elbow during the ongoing Test series between England and WI. Taskin has 23 wickets in 33 T20Is.

147.title: CBI arrests intelligence officer for taking ₹60 lakh bribe in Ghaziabad
147.article_body: Central Bureau of Investigation has arrested a senior intelligence officer, Mohit Dhankar, for allegedly taking a bribe of ₹60 lakh. The incident came to light when a businessman complained to the CBI about an alleged demand of ₹1 crore by the officer in return for a favour to the businessman's father who has a case against him.

148.title: Couple from Mumbai booked for abetting their 35-yr-old maid's suicide
148.article_body: A couple from Mumbai's Bandra was booked for allegedly abetting the suicide of a 35-year-old woman, who was working as a maid at their home. The woman, who was debt-ridden, was promised a salary of ₹11,000 initially and ₹15,000 after she learned cooking. The woman reportedly became depressed after the accused, dissatisfied with her work, asked her to stop working.

149.title: Which countries have opened criminal cases against Russia over war crimes in Ukraine?
149.article_body: Ukraine's Prosecutor General Iryna Venediktova has announced that six countries have already opened criminal cases in relation to Russian war crimes in Ukraine. They are Estonia, Lithuania, Germany, Poland, Slovakia and Sweden. "We'll work closely with them to facilitate exchange of information and evidence," she added. Russia started invasion of Ukraine on February 24.

150.title: Shocked by arrest, alleged torture of UP journalist: Editors Guild
150.article_body: Editors Guild of India (EGI) on Monday said that it's "shocked" by the manner in which a journalist based in Uttar Pradesh's Agra was arrested and allegedly tortured for reporting apparent malpractices in Assembly elections. It demanded Gaurav Bansal's immediate release and an independent court-monitored inquiry. Bansal's lawyer claimed that he was "tortured and humiliated" by police, EGI added.

151.title: Kaaranvir breaks down on 'Lock Upp' as he meets wife, daughters; video surfaces
151.article_body: Actor Kaaranvir Bohra, who is currently a contestant on the reality show 'Lock Upp', broke down when his wife Teejay Sidhu and daughters Bella, Vienna and Gia visited him on the show. In the video that was posted on his Instagram page, he can be seen crying while hugging his daughters. His youngest daughter can also be seen running around.

152.title: Now I'll sue all in UK, then see the fun: Lalit Modi on Bombay HC ruling in favour of him
152.article_body: After the Bombay High Court declared that the ₹425 crore Facilitation Fee in IPL broadcast rights case was legal and all parties, including BCCI, were aware of it, ex-IPL Chairman Lalit Modi said, "Today I feel vindicated as justice is delivered." "Now I will sue all in UK, then see the fun," he told Cricbuzz.

153.title: AAP MLA Kultar Sandhwan unanimously elected Punjab Assembly Speaker
153.article_body: Two-time Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) MLA Kultar Singh Sandhwan was unanimously elected as the Speaker of the 16th Punjab Legislative Assembly in Chandigarh on Monday. Mann, who had proposed Sandhwan's name in the House, congratulated him and said, "I hope you will give equal opportunity to everyone." Mann also urged the 46-year-old Speaker to allow live proceedings of the House.

154.title: LS Speaker Om Birla flagged off 'Prasadam Rath' from his residence in Delhi
154.article_body: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla flagged off the 'Prasadam Rath' from his residence in Delhi on Monday. "This free food scheme for the poor, underprivileged has been kickstarted across seven hospitals," Birla said. Through this initiative, the attendants of patients will get free food in the hospitals. "It will soon be expanded further in the national capital," Birla added.

155.title: Texas wildfires destroy 86 homes; sheriff’s deputy killed helping people
155.article_body: As many as 86 homes were reportedly destroyed as wildfires continued to rage in Texas. The fires which started on Wednesday or Thursday are said to have burned down 85% of the town of Carbon. A sheriff's deputy was killed as he tried to help people escape. "Everywhere you turn, it looks like a bomb went off," said an eyewitness.

156.title: I've always tried to play strong female protagonist in films: Rani
156.article_body: Actress Rani Mukerji said she has never accepted to be typecast or fit in a mould. "I've always tried to be part of meaningful films with a very strong female protagonist at the centre of the story," she added. Rani further said that she has always wanted to be a part of good films with important stories about Indian women.

157.title: Irrespective of being RR captain, Samson is among best T20 players: Sangakkara
157.article_body: RR's Director of Cricket and head coach Kumar Sangakkara has praised their captain Sanju Samson, stating that the 27-year-old has natural leadership qualities. "Irrespective of being RR captain, he's one of the best T20 players...He's a captain who is willing to admit that he doesn't know everything as yet and he is going to grow into it," Sangakkara added.

158.title: Director Girish Malik's son died by suicide after he was asked to stop drinking: Police
158.article_body: Director Girish Malik's 18-year-old son Mannan had died by suicide by jumping from the fifth floor of an apartment building in Mumbai on Friday, police have said. Mannan took the step at the Oberoi Springs building in Andheri after his father had allegedly asked him to stop drinking and behave well with his mother, added the police.

159.title: India evacuated 22,500 students, Indian nationals from Ukraine: Centre to SC
159.article_body: The Central Government has told the Supreme Court of India that 22,500 students and Indian nationals have been evacuated from Ukraine amid the ongoing crisis and that "a mammoth task has been completed". Centre also said students who returned from Ukraine have emphasised to government on issue of continuation of their studies here and that government is looking into issue.

160.title: Till Deepak Chahar comes into playing XI, CSK need to rely on Hangargekar: Irfan
160.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Irfan Pathan has said CSK need to rely on uncapped pacer Rajvardhan Hangargekar till Deepak Chahar becomes available for playing in the upcoming IPL season. "You know Hangargekar is a fantastic young talent...CSK have MS Dhoni...behind the stumps and that makes things a lot easier...So, I feel they nearly found some sort of replacement," Irfan added.

161.title: Actress-YouTuber Dolly D Cruze passes away aged 26 in road accident
161.article_body: Actress-YouTuber Dolly D Cruze died aged 26 in a road accident in Hyderabad. Dolly D Cruze, also known as Gayathri, met with an accident while returning home from a Holi party. She was travelling with a friend, who lost control of the vehicle and rammed into a divider. Dolly had recently worked in Telugu web series 'Madam Sir Madam Anthe'.

162.title: RGV praises The Kashmir Files, says 'I hate it; it destroyed whatever I learnt'
162.article_body: Filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma reviewed the film 'The Kashmir Files'. Taking to Twitter, Varma shared a video titled 'I hate Kashmir Files'. In the video, he praised the film and said, "'The Kashmir Files' released and broke every rule in the book." "I hate 'The Kashmir Files' because it destroyed whatever I learnt, whatever I thought was right," he added.

163.title: NDRF teams deployed in Andaman & Nicobar ahead of Cyclone Asani
163.article_body: As Cyclone Asani is likely to intensify into a deep depression in Andaman and Nicobar Islands, National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) personnel have been deployed at different locations. They have been provided with all the necessary equipment to carry out search and rescue operations. Indian Army, IAF and Indian Coast Guard have put their teams on stand by.

164.title: 4 killed, 1 missing as fishing boat sinks off New Zealand coast
164.article_body: A fishing boat sank off the New Zealand coast on Sunday killing four people. The rescue teams are looking for one person who went missing, while five others were moved to safety by a helicopter. The five were taken to a hospital and were released later. The boat had sent out a distress signal, following which the search operation began.

165.title: AAP nominates Harbhajan Singh, Raghav Chadha, IIT prof for RS from Punjab
165.article_body: Former cricketer Harbhajan Singh, IIT professor Sandeep Pathak, Delhi MLA Raghav Chadha and Lovely Professional University (LPU) Chancellor Ashok Mittal and industrialist Sanjeev Arora are the Aam Aadmi Party's (AAP) nominees for Rajya Sabha, party officials confirmed. The Rajya Sabha elections will be held on March 31. The party had won 92 of Punjab's 117 seats in the Assembly elections.

166.title: Will punish culprits: Bangladesh after 200 attack ISKCON temple
166.article_body: Bangladesh government has said in a statement on Monday that "exemplary punishment will be handed out to the guilty regardless of religion" in regard to the attack on an ISKCON temple in Dhaka by a mob of 200 people last week. According to the statement, the incident occurred following a legal dispute over the plot adjacent to the ISKCON temple.

167.title: May all aspirations be fulfilled: PM Narendra Modi on Parsi New Year
167.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday greeted the nation on the occasion of Navroz, which is also known as Parsi New Year. "We mark Navroz with a prayer that the coming year brings with it joy and outstanding health in everyone's lives. May all aspirations be fulfilled and may there be prosperity all around," the PM tweeted.

168.title: Woman tied, tortured by husband & in-laws with hot iron rod in MP's Dewas
168.article_body: A woman was allegedly tied by her husband and tortured by him and her in-laws with a hot iron rod, leaving her severely injured, in Madhya Pradesh's Dewas on March 16, Shailendra Mukati, TI, Barotha, said. "The woman was constantly troubled by her in-laws and her husband since giving birth to a daughter," Mukati added.

169.title: 21-yr-old man critical after girlfriend's stalker stabs him in Gujarat
169.article_body: A 21-year-old man, Jagdish, is reported to be critical after he was stabbed multiple times by another man Mukesh who had been engaged to Jagdish's current girlfriend four years ago. Mukesh was also stalking the woman. The engagement was broken due to Mukesh's drinking habits. "Mukesh and Jagdish have had verbal spats due to issue in the past," Police said.

170.title: Noida reports only one daily Covid-19 case for first time in 2022
170.article_body: The Gautam Buddha Nagar district reported only one Covid-19 case on Sunday, which is the lowest daily figure of this year, according to data from the district health department. The data further revealed that the number of active cases is 76 which is also an all-time low. However, the total cases recorded since the outbreak of the pandemic is 98,472.

171.title: Delhi court asks duo convicted for making fake trust using PM's name to repay victims
171.article_body: A Delhi court has ordered two men, who were convicted for creating a fake charitable trust under PM Narender Modi's name, to compensate the victims they had cheated. The court said the accused must compensate seven persons who had paid ₹25,599 as fees for a basic computer training programme. It also asked them to pay ₹50,000 as cost of prosecution.

172.title: Speeding vehicle kills woman in Gurugram
172.article_body: A woman, Sandhya Hazra (48), was killed allegedly by an unidentified speeding vehicle on the Golf Course Road (GCR) in Gurugram, police said. Hazra had migrated from Berhampore, West Bengal and worked as a maid in Gurugram. "We are trying to find out if there’s footage of any CCTV cameras," said Jang Bahadur, SHO of the Sector-53 Police Station.

173.title: Revamp of Kalyan yard will offer respite to local train passengers: Officials
173.article_body: The Kalyan yard remodelling, for which construction is underway, will help in segregating local and outstation trains, which will eventually bring respite to the commuters, said Railway officials. The remodelling will include the construction of four suburban railway tracks and six outstation train tracks along with others. Kalyan yard remodelling is expected to cost ₹866 crores, an official said.

174.title: Actress Sonam Kapoor announces pregnancy, shares pics
