174.article_body: Actress Sonam Kapoor took to Instagram to announce that she's expecting her first child with husband Anand Ahuja. Sharing pictures, she wrote, "Four hands. To raise you the very best we can. Two hearts. That will beat in unison with yours...every step of the way. One family. Who'll shower you with love and support. We can't wait to welcome you."

175.title: 2 women among 9 held for 50-yr-old man’s murder in Himachal Pradesh
175.article_body: The Mandi police in Himachal Pradesh arrested nine people, including two women, for the murder of a 50-year-old man on March 17. Last Thursday, police received information that a man, who was being chased by some people, had allegedly jumped into the Beas River from Bhiuli Bridge, a police official said. Later, victim's body was retrieved on Friday by divers.

176.title: As global COVID cases show uptick, Maha officials asked to be on alert
176.article_body: As several countries have been reporting a surge in the number of COVID-19 cases across globe, officials in Maharashtra have been asked to be on alert. State Health Minister Rajesh Tope reportedly said that the Central Government is keeping a close watch on the situation and that the state will issue guidelines accordingly.

177.title: Rapper Doja Cat spots fan in distress, stops performance, video surfaces
177.article_body: American rapper Doja Cat stopped her performance midway after she spotted a fan in the crowd in distress. "I love you guys, I really do. We can't have that happening...I'm sorry, I can't keep going if things aren't good," she said, adding, "It's nobody's fault. This stuff happens...There's a lot of people, and people get crushed. It's a lot."

178.title: Canada school board refuses to end mask mandate; parents criticise move
178.article_body: The Hamilton-Wentworth District School Board (HWDSB) in Canada's Ontario is facing criticism from parents for refusing to end the mask mandate. This comes after the provincial administration ordered an end to the mask mandate. "My kids will not be wearing masks,'' said a parent. Notably, 30 other public school boards have decided to go with the government's decision.

179.title: Barcelona are back, it was important to end losing streak: Xavi on Madrid win
179.article_body: After Barcelona registered their first win against Real Madrid in three years, manager Xavi Hernandez said the future looks bright for the club. "I'm happy because we were much better than Real Madrid. We played a spectacular match...nights like this are those you never forget," he added. Barcelona defeated Madrid 4-0 to secure their seventh win in last eight games.

180.title: Female bus conductor manhandled, abused by 2 passengers in Pune
180.article_body: Pune police have said that two passengers who allegedly manhandled and abused a 24-year-old female conductor on a Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Limited (PMPML) bus have been arrested. The incident occurred following a dispute between the complainant and accused over buying bus tickets, police added. The bus had been travelling from Pune Municipal Corporation to Nigdi, police further said.

181.title: 'Putul Utsav' to be held in 5 cities on World Puppetry Day on March 21
181.article_body: On the occasion of World Puppetry Day on March 21, Delhi's Sangeet Natak Akademi is organising a 'Putul Utsav' (puppet festival) in five cities on Monday. The festival will be celebrated in Delhi, Uttar Pradesh's Varanasi, Telangana's Hyderabad, Odisha's Angul and Tripura's Agartala. During the festival, tales of India's struggle for freedom will be retold through the medium of puppets.

182.title: Xi doesn't believe democracy can be sustained in 21st century: Biden
182.article_body: US President Joe Biden has said that his Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping "does not believe democracy can be sustained in the 21st century". He added that Jinping believed that autocracies will succeed because "democracies don't have time to arrive at consensus" as things move so "rapidly". "I think we're in a genuine struggle between autocracies and democracies," he further said.

183.title: Aamir performs Naatu Naatu song with Alia, Ram Charan & Jr NTR, video surfaces
183.article_body: A video has surfaced online where Aamir Khan attempted 'Naatu Naatu' dance steps with 'RRR' stars Jr NTR and Ram Charan at a recent promotional event for the film. Aamir tried to do the dance steps with Ram Charan, Jr NTR and said, "I can't do it." Alia Bhatt then added from behind, "It's very easy, even I learnt it."

184.title: BJP to fulfil promise of liberating Pakistan occupied Kashmir: Jitendra Singh
184.article_body: Union Minister Jitendra Singh said PM Narendra Modi-led BJP government will fulfil its promise to liberate Pakistan occupied Kashmir (PoK) just like it fulfilled its promise of abrogating Article 370. "When BJP promises something, it fulfils…Parliament passed a resolution unanimously in 1994, emphasising that Pakistan must vacate parts of J&K under its illegal occupation," Singh added.

185.title: LPG cylinder explodes in Maha; 4 seriously injured, suffer 80% burns
185.article_body: Four people suffered serious injuries after an LPG cylinder exploded in Maharashtra. The injured people suffered 80 per cent burn injuries in the incident, reports said. The explosion took place at a gas agency in Kalwa area of Maharashtra. According to the Thane Municipal Corporation, the injured have been admitted to the hospital after the incident.

186.title: Aryan, Jahnavi & Suhana are not just the future but present of KKR: Juhi
186.article_body: Actress Juhi Chawla's daughter Jahnavi participated in this year’s IPL auction ceremony. When asked if Jahnavi and actor Shah Rukh Khan's children, Aryan Khan and Suhana Khan can be tagged as the future of KKR, Juhi said, "Not just...future, they're...present of the team." "It's...funny how there was a time when our kids would be...home and we'd be on...screen," she added.

187.title: Hong Kong to ease COVID-19 curbs, lift flight ban from April
187.article_body: Hong Kong has announced the easing of strict COVID-19 restrictions, including lifting ban on flights from nine countries from April. Chief Executive Carrie Lam said the flight ban would end on April 1 and the hotel quarantine period for those arriving would be reduced from 14 days to seven. The offline classes in schools would resume on April 19.

188.title: What are the different ratings for pitches in Test cricket?
188.article_body: As per ICC, pitches in Test cricket have six specific ratings. Referees can rate pitches as very good, good, average, below average, poor or unfit. A pitch can be rated unfit if it is dangerous. An unfit pitch is given five demerit points, while poor pitches are given three demerit points. A below average pitch is given one demerit point.

189.title: PM Modi inspects 29 antiquities repatriated to India by Australia, video surfaces
189.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Monday inspected the 29 antiquities which have been repatriated to India by Australia. The antiquities range in six broad categories as per themes - Shiva and his disciples, Worshipping Shakti, Lord Vishnu and his forms, Jain tradition, portraits and decorative objects. These antiquities come from different time periods, with the earliest dating to 9th-10th century CE.

190.title: Delhi-Doha Qatar Airways flight diverted to Karachi after smoke detected in cargo hold
190.article_body: A Delhi-Doha Qatar Airways flight was diverted to Pakistan's Karachi airport after smoke was detected in the cargo hold. "Aircraft landed safely in Karachi where it was met by emergency services and passengers disembarked," Qatar Airways said. The incident is currently under investigation and a relief flight is being arranged to transport passengers onwards to Doha, it added.

191.title: Woman forces daughter to quit studies, work at Navi Mumbai bar; booked
191.article_body: Police have booked a woman and her live-in partner for forcing the woman's 17-year-old daughter to quit her studies and work at a beer bar to support family in Navi Mumbai. Following harassment by her mother and her live-in-partner, the girl ran away from home last month and was tracked down. However, she refused to live with her mother.

192.title: Ex-Ukraine MP's wife tries to leave country with $28 mn, €1.3 mn in suitcases
192.article_body: The wife of former Ukrainian MP Igor Kotvytskyy tried to leave the country with $28 million and €1.3 million in cash stuffed in suitcases. She was trying to escape Ukraine through Zakarpattia province. She was intercepted with the suitcases at the border by the Hungarian border guards and was forced to declare the amount.

193.title: Muslim traders not allowed to set up stalls at festival in K'taka's Shivamogga
193.article_body: The organising committee of Kote Marikamba Jatra, to be held in Karnataka's Shivamogga from Tuesday, reportedly refused to allot shops to Muslim traders. Leaders of BJP, Bajrang Dal and VHP had reportedly demanded that no Muslim be allowed to do business during the festival. "We agreed to their demand in interest of smooth conduct of the festival," committee chief said.

194.title: Ukraine refuses Russia's call to 'lay down arms' in Mariupol
194.article_body: After Russia gave Ukrainian forces in Mariupol until Monday morning to "lay down arms" in exchange for safe passage, Ukraine's Deputy PM Iryna Vereshchuk refused it and said, "There can be no talk of any surrender." "We've already informed...Russian side about this," she added. Earlier, the Mariupol city council had said that Russian forces bombed a school housing 400 residents.

195.title: 20-yr-old illegal arms dealer arrested in Gurugram; 25 pistols seized
195.article_body: A 20-year-old man was arrested for allegedly supplying illegal weapons in Gurugram on Sunday. The accused, identified as Abhishek alias Gabbar alias Kalu, was carrying multiple arms and ammunition, said police. "25 country-made pistols and two live cartridges, which he carried in a bag, have been seized… Our teams are conducting raids to nab his other associates," said police.

196.title: MakeMyTrip offers free homestays worth ₹50 lakh
196.article_body: MakeMyTrip has announced free homestays to 1,000 consumers on a first come first serve basis. Hundreds of users got their free homestays on the MakeMyTrip app yesterday as part of the offer, MakeMyTrip revealed. Users can avail the offer using coupon code 'FREEHOMESTAY' while choosing from 25,000+ properties. The offer is available from March 20 to 23.

197.title: Chandigarh admin declares 'The Kashmir Files' tax-free in Union Territory
197.article_body: The Chandigarh administration has declared Vivek Agnihotri's film 'The Kashmir Files' tax-free in the Union Territory. "Multiplexes and cinema theatre operators will not charge Union Territory Goods and Service Tax (UTGST) from the people. The order will be in effect for four months," an official statement read. The film has already been declared tax-free in several other states.

198.title: She looked rather lovely: Chunky on trolls criticising daughter Ananya's outfit
198.article_body: Actress Ananya Panday recently attended producer Apoorva Mehta's 50th birthday party, wearing a black thigh-high slit sheer dress. Several users trolled her for the choice of her outfit. Reacting to the trolls, her father, actor Chunky Panday said that Ananya looked "rather lovely". He  further added, "If her dad doesn't mind, then I don't think anyone else should mind."

199.title: Barcelona end 5-match losing streak vs Real Madrid with 4-0 win in El Clasico
199.article_body: Barcelona ended their five-match losing streak against Real Madrid with a 4-0 win in Sunday night's El Clasico. Ex-Arsenal striker Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang scored twice while Ronald Araujo and Ferran Torres added a goal each. The victory is Barcelona's seventh in their last eight games across competitions. They are now placed third on the La Liga points table with 54 points.

200.title: A lot has been said, what I'll do to silence them is perform: Andre Russell
200.article_body: West Indies all-rounder Andre Russell, who was retained by KKR ahead of the mega auction, has said he's proud to play for the franchise in the upcoming IPL season. "A lot has been said about me...But, what I'll do to silence them, is perform...kill the negativity with kindness," said Russell, who scored 183 runs in 10 games last season.

201.title: 4 people arrested in Lucknow for murder, violence on Holi
201.article_body: Four people were arrested in Lucknow on Sunday in connection with murder and violence on Holi, police officials said. Two people were arrested for the murder of a 35-year-old man in Madiyaon, the officials added. Two others were held for stabbing a 25-year-old man over a dispute during Holi revelry in Para, the officials stated.

202.title: Domestic help arrested for theft in Noida; ₹6.5 lakh cash recovered
202.article_body: A man named Shivam Kumar, working as a domestic help in Noida, has been arrested for allegedly robbing his employer's house in Noida sector 14. Police have also recovered ₹6.5 lakh cash and jewellery worth ₹5 lakh from the accused. Police said that Shivam had used master key to break into almirahs while the employer and his family were away.

203.title: Prez Kovind inaugurates Mughal-style heritage park in Delhi
203.article_body: President Ram Nath Kovind inaugurated a Mughal-era inspired heritage park near Jama Masjid in Delhi on Sunday. Named after Charti Lal Goel, the first speaker of the Delhi Legislative Assembly, the park is spread across 8,650 sqm. "One can find different features including baradaris, an open-air theatre, panorama, chhatris, among others at the park," said an official.

204.title: People seen burying dead neighbours by roadside in Ukraine's Mariupol
204.article_body: People were seen burying their dead neighbours in a makeshift grave by the roadside in Mariupol, a city in eastern Ukraine that has seen some of the heaviest bombardment since Russia began its invasion. A man said his neighbours were not killed by shells but had died of ailments worsened by the stress in lack of medical help.

205.title: Delhi's maximum temperature rises to 38°C; highest so far this season
205.article_body: The maximum temperature in Delhi on Sunday was recorded at 38.3 degrees Celsius, which is eight degrees above the normal for this time of the year at the Safdarjung weather observatory. This is the highest maximum temperature that Delhi has seen so far this season. The minimum temperature recorded on Sunday was 21.2 degrees Celsius, five degrees above normal.

206.title: No objection to teaching Bhagavad Gita in schools: Siddaramaiah
206.article_body: Former Karnataka CM and Leader of Opposition Siddaramaiah said that he does not have any objections to teaching the Bhagavad Gita in schools. "Children are taught Bhagavad Gita, Ramayana and Mahabharata at home as well. Moral education should be taught to children," Siddaramaiah added. "The country believes in a pluralistic society and we believe in harmony and tolerance," he stated.

207.title: Preity Zinta shares pics from her first Holi in US since becoming mother
207.article_body: Actress and Punjab Kings owner Preity Zinta took to Instagram to share pictures from her first Holi since becoming mother. She wrote, "Even though the world isn't perfect right now & there is little to celebrate...We couldn't let...Holi go by without celebrating it as new parents. Our first big desi celebration since the pandemic & since the babies were born."

208.title: 19-yr-old driver of SUV that hit and killed infant in Hyderabad arrested
208.article_body: A 19-year-old man, Syed Afnan Ahmed, has been arrested after the SUV he was driving, hit and killed an infant in Hyderabad on March 17. Police said that the SUV had rammed into three street vendors and the two infants who were in their mothers' laps had fallen down. One of them was later declared dead at Apollo hospital.

209.title: How can I be an outsider if PM can contest from Varanasi: Sinha
209.article_body: TMC candidate for Asansol Shatrughan Sinha on Sunday questioned the BJP's allegation that he is an "outsider from Bihar", saying, "How can I be an outsider if PM Narendra Modi who comes from Gujarat [can] contest from Kashi (Varanasi)." Furthermore, he praised West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee and called her a "historic leader in true sense and a tigress".

210.title: Mother delayed death to help us be accustomed to emptiness: KPAC Lalitha's son
210.article_body: Late actress KPAC Lalitha's son Sidharth Bharathan said that he feels his mother delayed her own death to help them get accustomed to the emptiness she would leave behind. "She did not leave us at once...she stopped talking, stopped responding...stayed like that for a while. Towards the end, she lost her memory. She did not respond to anything," Sidharth added.

211.title: Cong doesn't know many of its MLAs will join BJP: Sarma on RS polls
211.article_body: Ahead of Rajya Sabha elections for two seats in Assam, state CM Himanta Biswa Sarma on Sunday said that "Congress doesn't know that many of their MLAs are going to join the BJP." He added that "candidates are not bound to follow the whip issued in the party" in these polls. "We'll manage to get both the seats," he asserted.

212.title: India reports 1,549 new COVID-19 cases, 31 deaths; active cases at 25,106
212.article_body: India has reported 1,549 new COVID-19 cases and 31 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. Out of the 31 deaths, 11 deaths occurred during the day in the country, while 20 were reconciled deaths in Kerala. India's COVID-19 death toll reached 5,16,510, and the active cases declined to 25,106.

213.title: Pune records 29 new COVID-19 infections, active cases drop below 500
213.article_body: The Pune district recorded 29 new COVID-19 cases on Sunday including four in Pune rural and 19 in Pune city. The number of active cases in the district dropped below 500, standing at 420. No deaths were registered during this period, keeping the total fatality count at 20,513. Over 1.75 crore vaccine doses have been administered so far.

214.title: Taylor Fritz ends Nadal's 20-match winning streak to win Indian Wells title
214.article_body: American player Taylor Fritz ended 21-time Grand Slam champion Rafael Nadal's 20-match winning streak to win the BNP Paribas Open. Fritz, who had an injured ankle, defeated Nadal 6-3, 7-6 (7-5) to claim his career's second ATP Tour trophy. "This is just one of those childhood dreams you just think would never come true," said Fritz.

215.title: Akshaye Khanna deserves lot of credit for Race's success; he's gifted: Saif
215.article_body: Actor Saif Ali Khan, who worked with actor Akshaye Khanna in 'Race', praised his performance in the film. Speaking about Akshaye, Saif said, "Akshaye deserves a lot of credit for making 'Race' what it is by performing his role in such a special way." "He is...a gifted actor and he had a lot of fun with that role," Saif added.

216.title: Hyd body urge to speak against domestic violence, say 'help will arrive'
216.article_body: The Women and Children Safety Wing of Cyberabad in Hyderabad took to Twitter to share a post about domestic violence and urged people to speak about it. The safety wing also provided number for victims to call on. "Report crimes against women and help will arrive soon," the post read. It also said, "Don't keep your lips sealed shut."

217.title: 4 arrested as interstate drugs racket busted in Hyd, heroin seized
217.article_body: An interstate drugs racket was busted by a Special Operation Team of the Hyderabad Police. The official Twitter handle of Rachakonda Police confirmed that four people were arrested by officers following the raid. The force seized 16 grams of heroin (brown sugar), which had been transported from West Bengal to Hyderabad, cash and five mobile phones from their possession.

218.title: Son of shop owner and worker fall into basement of Delhi factory, suffocate to death
218.article_body: Two men suffocated to death after they slipped on makeshift stairs and fell into a basement filled with wooden logs at a cycle rickshaw assembling factory in Delhi. Police said the logs were sprayed with pesticide, used to prevent foliage and insect growth on wood, which led to the deaths. The stairs were made with loose planks, police added.

219.title: Body of 21-year-old Indian student killed in Ukraine arrives in Bengaluru
219.article_body: The body of the 21-year-old Indian student who was killed in Russian shelling in war-torn Ukraine arrived in Bengaluru in the early hours of Monday. Naveen Shekharappa Gyanagoudar, who was studying at the Kharkiv National Medical University, died on March 1. Gyanagoudar's family members and Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai were present at Bengaluru airport to receive the body.

220.title: Biden to travel to Ukraine's neighbour Poland over Russian invasion
220.article_body: US President Joe Biden will travel to Poland on Friday to meet President Andrzej Duda for discussions over Russia's invasion of Ukraine, the White House has said. "The President will discuss how the US, alongside our Allies and partners, is responding to the humanitarian and human rights crisis that Russia's unjustified and unprovoked war on Ukraine has created," it said.

221.title: When is a Test match pitch rated 'below average'?
221.article_body:
As per ICC, a pitch is rated 'below average' when it has either very little carry and/or bounce and/or more than occasional seam movement, or occasional variable (but not excessive or dangerous) bounce and/or occasional variable carry. "A pitch...with...these features...cannot be rated in higher category regardless
of the amount of turn it displays at any stage," the rule further states.

222.title: Railways to resume seasonal pass service on Pune-Mumbai route
222.article_body: The Central Railway will resume the seasonal pass and unreserved passenger services on the Pune-Mumbai route from March 22, said authorities. The services will be made available for Deccan Queen Express, Intercity Express, Indrayani Express, Deccan Express and Sinhagad Express trains. Notably, the services had been stopped since March 2020 owing to COVID-19 pandemic.

223.title: B'luru customs seize antique bronze statue from shipment; 1 held
223.article_body: Bengaluru Airport and Air Cargo Commissionerate's Customs Intelligence Unit officials on Sunday intercepted a shipment containing an antique bronze statue of Lord Vishnu, believed to be over a hundred years old. The exporter, who was attempting to send it to Malaysia, has been arrested. The statue was certified by a nominee authorised by the Director General, Archaeological Survey of India.

224.title: 3 threaten man out on walk, force him to transfer ₹76,000 in Pune
224.article_body: An FIR has been filed after three persons allegedly threatened to kill a man and his female friend and forced the man to digitally transfer ₹76,000 in Pune. The duo had been out on a walk on Pashan Hill and was sitting on a rock when the accused approached them, according to the FIR. The incident took place on Friday.

225.title: Every Indian must watch 'The Kashmir Files': Aamir Khan
225.article_body: Aamir Khan has said every Indian must watch 'The Kashmir Files'. "What happened to Kashmiri Pandits is a matter of great sorrow. Such a film must be watched by all Indians so...they can remember what occurred," he said. "This film has touched...emotions of all people who believe in humanity and that is what is so beautiful about it," stated Aamir.

226.title: Dad never let me use family name privilege: Mithun's son
226.article_body: Actor Mithun Chakraborty's son Mimoh Chakraborty said that his father never let him use the "privilege of family name" and that he is facing his own demons. "He [Mithun] told me that if I wanted something I have to earn it," Mimoh said, adding that Mithun's work is "unlimited" and that "there is no stopping him".

227.title: 30 arrested after police raid bar in Mumbai's Malad; 25 women rescued
227.article_body: Thirty persons were arrested and 25 women were rescued after Mumbai Police's Crime Branch raided a bar in the city's Malad area. "A decoy customer found women dancing in violation of norms, following which the raid was carried out," a police officer said. The 30 arrested persons include customers, waiters and other staff of the eatery-cum-bar, according to the officer.

228.title: 1,000 Olive Ridley turtle hatchlings released on Visakhapatnam beach
228.article_body: As many as 1,000 hatchlings of Olive Ridley turtles were released into the sea at Visakhapatnam's RK Beach on Sunday. District collector Mallikarjuna and forest officials reportedly released the endangered turtles into the water. District Forest Officer Anant Shankar said multiple hatcheries have been set up by their team to protect the rare turtles from being eaten by other animals.

229.title: Elon Musk among witnesses in Johnny Depp & Amber Heard's court case
229.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk has been included in list of witnesses slated to testify in a defamation lawsuit filed by Johnny Depp against his ex-wife Amber Heard. Depp has alleged that Heard had an extra-marital affair with Musk and James Franco while they were married. Both Musk and Franco are scheduled to testify virtually during the trial next month.

230.title: Paris taxi driver files complaint against Tesla for crash that killed 1
230.article_body: A Paris taxi driver has filed a legal complaint against Tesla after his Tesla Model 3 crashed in December, killing one person. The driver told police that the car accelerated on its own and that he was unable to activate the brakes. Earlier, the French government while quoting Tesla said there was no immediate indication of a technical fault.

231.title: 2 Mumbai metro corridors likely to become operational by mid-April
231.article_body: The Mumbai Metropolitan Region Development Authority (MMRDA) said the Dahisar East-DN Nagar and Dahisar East-Andheri East metro corridors will likely get safety clearance by March-end. Around two to three days of safety inspection is pending, officials said. They added that after receiving the safety clearance certificates, the two corridors are likely to become operational by mid-April.

232.title: Kashmiri pandits' pain too tragic to be manipulated: Cong MP Gogoi
232.article_body: Congress MP Gaurav Gogoi on Sunday took to Twitter to ask whether an Indian mode of healing and reconciliation in Kashmir could be developed. He added, "The pain and anguish of Kashmiri Pandits are too real and tragic to be...ignored or...manipulated. People of J&K deserve peace, justice and fraternity." His comments came amid the ongoing controversy around 'The Kashmir Files'.

233.title: Multipurpose women's co-op societies to start in all K'taka taluks
233.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai on Sunday announced that the multipurpose women's cooperative societies will be started in every taluk of the state. The societies are understood to have 90% share capital from the state government. CM Bommai said the "government has decided to establish a milk producers bank to ensure that the profit goes to milk producers".

234.title: Man tries to enter Hindon air base illegally, arrested by IAF
234.article_body: A man has been apprehended by Indian Air Force officials after he allegedly attempted to get inside the force's Hindon airbase near Delhi in an unauthorised manner. The incident is said to have taken place in the city on Sunday. An IAF official informed that the accused has been handed over to local police for further action following initial interrogation.

235.title: AAP's Gopal Rai inaugurates new party office in Chhattisgarh
235.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) leader Gopal Rai inaugurated a new party office in Chhattisgarh's Raipur on Sunday. "We've been receiving...calls from...people of the state to join the party," said Rai who'll be participating in 'Vijay Yatra' in the capital on Monday to mark AAP's victory in Punjab. The party is reportedly planning to contest the Chhattisgarh assembly elections next year.

236.title: Coimbatore school teacher runs first cactus museum in Tamil Nadu
236.article_body: A school teacher in Coimbatore is reportedly running the first cactus museum in Tamil Nadu. The teacher, identified as Sheemalatha, said the museum has over a thousand varieties of the plant. She added, "I've been growing cactus since 2006 to create awareness among people who think cactus resembles negativity."  Pictures from the place show students examining the plant's different varieties.

237.title: Remove genitalia models from family planning kits, Maha govt urged
237.article_body: Political parties and activists in Maharashtra's Buldhana district have urged state government to remove "embarrassing" rubber models of male and female reproductive organs from family planning counselling kits. "How will Asha workers explain about it?" Prashant Dikkar of Swabhimani Shetkari Sanghatana said. Meanwhile, a social worker claimed Asha workers had approached her saying they feel shy.

238.title: They're never flustered: Cummins on Kohli, Babar, Root, Williamson
238.article_body: Commenting on similarities between top batters in the world including Virat Kohli, Kane Williamson, Joe Root and Babar Azam, Australia Test captain Pat Cummins said they're "never flustered" and are happy to bat for long periods of time. "All know their game incredibly well...if there's an opportunity, they get off the mark pretty quickly, start accumulating...runs really quickly," he stated.

239.title: Federer is guitar solo, Nadal, Serena are like heavy metal: Musician Wentz
239.article_body: Asked to describe musical comparisons of playing styles of Roger Federer, Rafael Nadal and Serena Williams, musician Pete Wentz said Federer is a "guitar solo" and for Nadal and Serena their game resembles "heavy metal". He added, "When you see Federer play, you're seeing something that's so incredibly beautiful." Wentz is bassist and lyricist for rock band Fall Out Boy.

240.title: State govt hoarded 'tuvar dal', over 70 lakh people affected: Cong
240.article_body: The Gujarat government, along with black marketers, has hoarded 'tuvar dal' supply for the past four months, the Congress said on Sunday. Gujarat Pradesh Congress Committee (GPCC) spokesperson Manish Doshi accused the state government of not providing 'tuvar dal' to over 70.81 lakh beneficiaries, adding that several claims about distributing food grains at cheaper rates were made in the past.

241.title: Nashik Police to summon Rajasthan CM's son in cheating case
241.article_body: Nashik Police has said that it'll summon 14 accused in a cheating case, including Rajasthan’s Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot's son Vaibhav Gehlot, for questioning this week. This comes after a complaint was filed by a Nashik-based businessman on March 17 who claimed that he was lured into investing in a company with which Vaibhav was allegedly affiliated.

242.title: UP govt creates 5,000 new police posts across units like ATS & STF
242.article_body: The Yogi Adityanath-led Uttar Pradesh government has announced the creation of 5,000 new posts across several units of the police, including the Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS) and Special Task Force (STF). The UP Police is also set to get a specialised team to keep an eye on drone activities to boost security in the state, according to reports.

243.title: Lakshya Sen wins silver at All England Open, loses to world no. 1 Axelsen in final
243.article_body: India's 20-year-old shuttler Lakshya Sen won the silver medal at All England Open Badminton Championships 2022, bagging India's first medal in men's singles in the tournament in 21 years. World number one men's player Viktor Axelsen of Denmark defeated Lakshya with a scoreline of 21-10, 21-15 to win his second All England Open title.

244.title: Drunk driver, conductor abandon bus with passengers in Guj; booked
244.article_body: A driver and a conductor, who abandoned a passenger-filled state transport bus in Gujarat's Ahmedabad after causing an accident while in an inebriated state on Sunday, have been booked under the Prohibition Act. The pair are, however, yet to be identified. Police said that they recovered six bottles of illicit Indian Made Foreign Liquor 'whisky' from the driver’s cabin.

245.title: 10,000 people attend 'anti-war' concert in Berlin amid Ukraine crisis
245.article_body: Around 10,000 people attended an 'anti-war' concert in Berlin on Sunday to express solidarity with Ukraine, police said. The concert took place near Brandenburg Gate, which was symbol of divided Germany during Cold War, with people waving Ukrainian flags and holding anti-invasion banners. The performers included Natalia Klitschko, a Ukrainian singer who's married to Kyiv's Mayor Vitali Klitschko.

246.title: Reigning world champion Yamaguchi wins maiden All England title
246.article_body: Reigning world champion Akane Yamaguchi won her maiden All England Championships women's singles title in Birmingham on Sunday. The 24-year-old second seed defeated fourth seed An Seyoung 21-15, 21-15 of Korea in 44 minutes. Yamaguchi had reached the final in 2018 but lost to Tai Tzu Ying. It's the Japanese shuttler's 18th career and a ninth world tour title.

247.title: PayPal expands services for Ukrainian users, waives transaction fees
247.article_body: PayPal said it is expanding services in Ukraine and Ukrainians will now be able to send and receive money from friends and family. Earlier, PayPal users in Ukraine could only send money internationally from their accounts and not receive it. PayPal is also waiving transaction fees for remittances to Ukrainian accounts.

248.title: Zelenskyy questions lack of 'powerful' Israeli sanctions on Russia
248.article_body: During his address to the Israeli Parliament, Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said, "Why Israel hasn't imposed powerful sanctions on Russia or isn't putting pressure on Russian business." He also questioned Israel's reluctance to sell the Iron Dome system to Ukraine. "Everybody knows that your missile defence systems are the best...and that you can definitely help...save...lives," he said.

249.title: PM Modi clearly used his contacts to call for end of war: Australia
249.article_body: Australian High Commissioner to India Barry O'Farrell said the Quad nations of Australia, Japan and the US have accepted India's stand on the Russia-Ukraine conflict. "It's clear from the comments of...Prime Minister Narendra Modi...that he has used his contacts to call for the end of the conflict and no country will be unhappy with that," said O'Farrell.

250.title: Hyderabad FC clinch their maiden ISL title after defeating Kerala Blasters on penalties
250.article_body: Hyderabad FC defeated Kerala Blasters 3-1 on penalties in final to win their maiden Indian Super League (ISL) title. Rahul KP scored for Kerala Blasters in 68th minute before Hyderabad FC's Sahil Tavora equalised in 88th minute as the match went to extra time and then penalties. Kerala Blasters have now lost all of their three finals in ISL.

251.title: Govt plans to merge BBNL and BSNL this month: BSNL chief
251.article_body: Bharat Sanchar Nigam Limited (BSNL) Chairman and MD PK Purwar said the government has decided to merge BSNL and Bharat Broadband Nigam Limited (BBNL) this month. He added that the government has given BSNL an opportunity to turnaround their losses. With the proposed merger, BSNL will get 5.67 lakh kilometre of optical fibre network laid across 1.85 lakh village panchayats.

252.title: 'Donate 'The Kashmir Files' profits for Brahmin kids,' says MP IAS officer
252.article_body: MP Public Works Department's Deputy Secretary Niyaz Khan has triggered a controversy by saying that all the earnings of 'The Kashmir Files' must be donated for Brahmin children's education and construction of homes for them in Kashmir. "It will be a great charity," said Khan in a now-viral tweet. MP minister Vishwas Sarang said he'll seek action against Khan.

253.title: K'taka CM thanks PM for efforts to bring Naveen's body from Ukraine
253.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Sunday wrote a letter to PM Narendra Modi to thank him for his efforts in bringing back the mortal remains of Naveen Shekharappa, who was killed in the Ukrainian city of Kharkiv. The fourth-year medical student from Karnataka was killed in a shelling attack. His mortal remains will reach Bengaluru on March 21.

254.title: Attempts being made to divide the country once again: Mehbooba
254.article_body: Former Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Mehbooba Mufti on Sunday said that attempts are being made to divide the country once again on communal lines. "If we allow this religious division to happen, the sacrifice of freedom fighters like Bhagat Singh will go in vain. Therefore, do not allow Gandhi to die once again," she further said.

255.title: 42-year-old man abducts, rapes 8-year-old girl in Nagpur; arrested
255.article_body: A 42-year-old man was arrested for allegedly raping a mentally unwell eight-year-old girl in Nagpur's  Imamwada area on Sunday, police said. The accused, who runs a juice stall in the locality, allegedly abducted the girl and raped her at his house, police added. The victim later narrated the ordeal to her sister, following which a police complaint was registered.

256.title: US Indo-Pacific strategy as dangerous as NATO expansion in Europe: China
256.article_body: China's Vice Foreign Minister Le Yucheng on Saturday said that the US' Indo-Pacific strategy and creation of groups such as Quad are as "dangerous" as NATO's eastward expansion in Europe. "The Ukraine crisis...provides a mirror for us to observe the situation in the Asia-Pacific," he added. Notably, Chinese officials have blamed NATO's potential expansion for triggering the crisis in Ukraine.

257.title: Vinod Kapri shares clip of 19-yr-old man running in Noida at midnight, video viral
257.article_body: Filmmaker Vinod Kapri has shared a video of a 19-year-old man running in Noida at midnight. In the clip, Kapri offered Pradeep Mehra a lift, which he refused and said he runs 10 km daily, from his job in Sector 16 to his home in Barola. Refusing dinner with Kapri, Mehra said his brother back home will be left hungry.

258.title: Leclerc wins F1 2022 season-opening race, Max Verstappen fails to finish
258.article_body: Ferrari driver Charles Leclerc won the Bahrain Grand Prix, the first race of Formula One 2022 season, with his teammate Carlos Sainz finishing second. Meanwhile, Formule One 2021 champion Max Verstappen failed to finish the race due to a mechanical issue with his car. Seven-time world champion Lewis Hamilton finished third after Sergio Perez spun in the last lap.

259.title: At least 10 dead after consuming spurious liquor in Bihar on Holi
259.article_body: At least 10 people died after consuming spurious liquor in two districts of dry Bihar during Holi celebrations, police said on Sunday. Eight deaths were reported in the Bhagalpur district, including four in the Sahebganj locality of Bhagalpur town and the remaining in different villages in the Narayanpur police station area.

260.title: Importance of Alia's character in 'RRR' is high: Director Rajamouli
260.article_body: 'RRR' director SS Rajamouli said Alia Bhatt's role in the film isn't a full-fledged character but is an important cameo. He added they needed a "fragile-looking girl" with "enough inner strength" to lead Ram Charan and Jr NTR's characters in a proper way. Talking about the length of character, Rajamouli stated, "It's less but the importance of the character is...high."

261.title: Haryana Guv, CM inaugurate 35th Surajkund International Crafts Mela
261.article_body: Haryana Governor Bandaru Dattatreya and Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar on Sunday inaugurated the 35th Surajkund International Crafts Mela. Governor Dattatreya praised the Ministries of central government and Haryana government during the session for organising it. CM Khattar said the fair helps thousands of craftspersons from India to showcase their arts and products to a wider audience.

262.title: China fully militarised 3 islands in South China Sea: US Admiral
262.article_body: US' Indo-Pacific commander Admiral John Aquilino on Sunday said that China has fully militarised at least three of several islands it built in the disputed South China Sea. China has deployed anti-ship and anti-aircraft missile systems, laser and jamming equipment and fighter jets on them, he added. The efforts are part of China flexing its military muscle, he further said.

263.title: At least 115 children killed, over 150 hurt in Ukraine so far: Report
263.article_body: At least 115 children were killed in Ukraine since Russia invaded Ukraine on February 24, reported local media citing Ukrainian Chief Prosecutor's office. The prosecutor's office added that more than 150 children were injured in Ukraine since the invasion began. “These numbers are not just figures but the scale of grief... of hundreds of Ukrainian families,” the prosecutor's office said.

264.title: BJP promoting 'The Kashmir Files' to win Guj, Raj elections: Raut
264.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut on Sunday accused the BJP of promoting 'The Kashmir Files' with an eye on the forthcoming Assembly polls in Gujarat and Rajasthan. He added that an attempt has been made in the film to suppress several "harsh truths". The film has been brought to the screen with inspiration from the Sangh Parivar (RSS), he claimed.

265.title: Ranvir in 'Race' was an opportunity to play more serious role: Saif
265.article_body: Actor Saif Ali Khan, talking about his role in the 2008 film 'Race', said that playing Ranvir in the film was an opportunity for him to play "a slightly more serious role". He added, "At that point, I had done a lot of chocolate boy roles and Race was different." The film completes 14 years of its release on Monday.

266.title: My tenure as Goa CM is over, will gladly accept duty given: Sawant
266.article_body: Ahead of BJP's legislature party meeting in Goa, state's caretaker CM Pramod Sawant has said he'll "gladly accept" whatever responsibility BJP gives him. "My...tenure has come to an end...I'm happy that I was able to get 20 seats for [BJP]," he said. The decision about the swearing-in ceremony of the next CM will be taken on Monday, Sawant had said.

267.title: He just stands and hits them out of park: KL Rahul on Shreyas Iyer
267.article_body: Praising Shreyas Iyer for his ability to tackle spin and putting spinners under pressure, LSG skipper KL Rahul said he "dreads" KKR captain when his side plays against them in upcoming IPL. "He's one of the players who doesn't really step out too much...is a tall boy, so has a long reach. He just stands...hits them out of...park," he stated.

268.title: Our Hindutva not like BJP, Shiv Sena won't ally with AIMIM: Maha CM
268.article_body: Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray said that Shiv Sena will not form an alliance with Asaduddin Owaisi and All India Majlis-e-Ittehadul Muslimeen, adding that his party's Hindutva is not like BJP. He also asked Shiv Sena's members to be ready to defeat BJP. Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut on Saturday called AIMIM the "B team" of the BJP.

269.title: PM Modi has given respect to North-Eastern states: Tripura CM
269.article_body: Tripura Chief Minister Biplab Kumar Deb on Sunday said PM Narendra Modi "has given respect to the North-Eastern states". "All the Chief Ministers of the North-East region have been tied into the same string of development," Deb said. He added that only after PM Modi came to power did Chief Ministers of small states get "equal importance and patient hearing".

270.title: US toy company raises money for Ukraine with Zelenskyy's 'Lego' figures
270.article_body: A Chicago artist has designed a Lego-style figurine of the Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy in a bid to raise money for Ukraine. Joe Trupia, the owner of Citizen Brick, a toy manufacturing company, has no personal connections to the war but felt compelled to help. Citizen Brick has raised over $145,000 and donated it to a charity organisation helping Ukraine.

271.title: Russian attack kills 56 people at nursing home in Luhansk: Report
271.article_body: Russian tank attack killed 56 people at a nursing home in Ukraine's Luhansk Oblast on March 11, reported local media citing Luhansk Governor Serhiy Hayday. Hayday added Russians moved 15 survivors to a facility in the occupied territories. Meanwhile, at least 902 civilians were killed and 1,459 injured since Russia launched a full-scale invasion of Ukraine on February 24.

272.title: When is a movie declared tax-free?
272.article_body: There are no fixed criteria for a film to claim or enjoy tax exemption and the decision to give up tax revenues by state governments are taken on a film-to-film basis. When a film deals with a socially relevant or inspiring subject, state governments waive tax on it to make it accessible to a wider audience.

273.title: Thieves break into BJP MP's Chhattisgarh home on Holi, steal ₹1 lakh
273.article_body: Thieves broke into the residence of BJP Rajya Sabha MP Ramvichar Netam in Chhattisgarh's Ambikapur on Holi on Friday and stole ₹1 lakh, police said on Sunday. A senior police officer said that guards of his residence are being questioned. He added that the police are investigating the matter.

274.title: Germany secures Qatar energy deal amid Russia gas supply tensions
274.article_body: Germany and Qatar have agreed upon a long-term energy partnership to help cut reliance on Russian gas amid its invasion of Ukraine, German Economic Minister Robert Habeck said on Sunday. "Although we might still need Russian gas this year, in...future [we won't]," Habeck added. Notably, Germany also suspended its Nord Stream 2 pipeline project with Russia last month.

275.title: Ferry struck by cargo ship sinks in river in Bangladesh, 6 dead
275.article_body: At least six people were killed after a ferry packed with passengers collided with a cargo vessel on a river and sank in central Bangladesh on Sunday. Dozens of passengers are still missing and a rescue operation for them is being carried out, officials said. Nearly two dozen people had managed to swim ashore, an official said.

276.title: Section 144 imposed in Nizamabad after clash over new Shivaji statue
276.article_body: Telangana government imposed Section 144 in the Nizamabad district on Sunday after members of two political groups clashed over the installation of a statue of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj. The order is said to have been imposed in the Bodhan town to prohibit further escalation of the matter. Activists of both parties reportedly pelted stones at each other during the clash.

277.title: Schools, colleges shut in Andaman & Nicobar ahead of Cyclone Asani
277.article_body: All schools and colleges have been closed amid heavy rains and strong winds in the Andaman and Nicobar islands ahead of Cyclone Asani. The Union Territory's administration has taken the step as a preventive measure beginning March 21. All planned boat sailings in the foreshore zone have also been cancelled and passengers are being encouraged to consult helpline numbers.

278.title: Appalling and awful: UK FM on ferry firm firing 800 staff over Zoom
278.article_body: UK's Finance Minister Rishi Sunak said the way that P&O Ferries has treated its workers is appalling and awful. The UK-based ferry company last week fired 800 employees without any warning over a Zoom video. According to a report by Sunday Times, several government ministers were aware of the company's plans to fire employees before P&O Ferries' staff was informed.

279.title: 3 live hand grenades found outside pvt university in Haryana
279.article_body: Three live hand grenades were recovered from an empty ground outside a private university on the Ambala-Chandigarh highway in Haryana on Sunday, police said. They have been defused, the Superintendent of Police (SP) said. He added that the NIA and other central agencies have also been informed.

280.title: All parties, including mine, divide people: Congress' Ghulam Nabi
280.article_body: Congress leader Ghulam Nabi Azad, speaking at an event in Jammu on Sunday, said that all political parties, including his own, create divisions among the people along caste and religious lines. He added, "Civil society should stay together. Justice must be given to everyone irrespective of caste and religion." His remarks came amid the ongoing controversy over 'The Kashmir Files'.

281.title: PM chairs meeting over govt formation in UP, U'khand, Goa: Reports
281.article_body: PM Narendra Modi chaired a meeting at his residence on Sunday over the government formation in Uttar Pradesh, Uttarakhand and Goa, as per reports. Union Ministers Amit Shah and Rajnath Singh, BJP National General Secretary (organisation) BL Santhosh, party President JP Nadda were reportedly present. Yogi Adityanath will take oath as UP CM for the second term on March 25.

282.title: Indian cueist Pankaj Advani wins 8th Asian Billiards C'ship title
282.article_body: Indian cueist Pankaj Advani defeated compatriot Dhruv Sitwala 6-2 to win his eighth title at 19th Asian Billiards Championship 2022 on Saturday in Doha, Qatar. Overall, it was the 24-time world champion's 12th Asian title. "This isn't a quadrennial event, it tests you every single year, every single match!" said Pankaj. Notably, it was 36-year-old Pankaj's 41st international title.

283.title: Working to improve tax literacy & number of taxpayers: CBDT chief
283.article_body: CBDT Chairman JB Mohapatra said the Income Tax department is working to improve the "abysmally poor" tax literacy in the country to increase the number of taxpaying entities and enhance collections. "Banks have invested in expanding the banking knowledge of the people. That thing has not happened in (income) tax and that is on top of our mind," he said.

284.title: Tiger is biggest action hero the industry currently has: Ahmed Khan
284.article_body: Director Ahmed Khan has said that Tiger Shroff is the biggest and the youngest action hero the film industry currently has. "The way he manoeuvres complex action sequences and makes them look super effortless, speaks volumes of his constant dedication because this guy...puts his 200% into his work," he added. Tiger's upcoming film 'Heropanti 2' is directed by Ahmed.

285.title: No, not really: Kanye's girlfriend Chaney on if she resembles Kim
285.article_body: On being asked if she sees the resemblance between herself and Kim Kardashian, rapper Kanye West's girlfriend Chaney Jones replied, "No, not really." Chaney added that she and Kanye don't talk about Kim. Instagram model Chaney gained popularity for being a lookalike of Kim. Earlier, Chaney took to Instagram and posted pictures with Kanye and captioned it, "Date night."

286.title: Haven't had kaju katli in 27 years, sugar is biggest poison: John
286.article_body: During a True or False session with Shilpa Shetty, actor John Abraham revealed that he hasn't had his favourite sweet, kaju katli, for 27 years. "I believe...that sugar is the biggest poison in the world, more than cigarette smoking," he stated. John further added that he does not have aerated drinks. John will next be seen in 'Ek Villain Returns'.

287.title: I'm not very good at handling stress and pressure: Ananya Panday
287.article_body: Ananya Panday has said that she's not good at handling work stress and pressure. "I'm quite young...sometimes it gets to me...but I try to detach myself, spend time with my friends and my family, and ground myself in the real world," she added. Ananya further said, "I like to do things that make me happy or make time for myself."

288.title: Punjab govt forms new SIT in SAD leader Majithia's drug case
288.article_body: The newly-formed Punjab government has formed a new Special Investigation Team (SIT) to probe Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) leader Bikram Singh Majithia in a drug case. The four-member SIT will be headed by Assistant Inspector General of Police Rahul S. Majithia is currently lodged in the Patiala jail as his judicial custody was earlier extended till March 22.

289.title: Cong holds 'Tiranga Yatra' in MP, observes 'Samvidhan Samman Diwas'
289.article_body: The Congress Committee in Madhya Pradesh's Indore took out a 'Tiranga Yatra' on Sunday to mark two years since the day Kamal Nath resigned as CM after his government was toppled. Party workers shouted anti-BJP slogans while observing the day as 'Samvidhan Samman Diwas'. "BJP had insulted...Constitution by forming...government by horse-trading," City Congress president Vinay Bakliwal said.

290.title: If talks with Putin fail, it could mean third world war: Zelenskyy
290.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has said that he is ready for negotiations with Russian President Vladimir Putin, adding, "But if they fail, it could mean World War 3." He added, "If there's just 1% chance for us to stop this war, I think that we need to take this chance." He said that negotiations are crucial to ending the war.

291.title: Reliance Retail acquires 89% stake in women's innerwear brand Clovia
291.article_body: Reliance Retail Ventures Limited (RRVL) has acquired an 89% equity stake in Purple Panda Fashions Private Limited, which owns and operates Clovia, a brand for women's innerwear and loungewear. Reliance made an investment of ₹950 crore through a combination of secondary stake purchase and primary investment. Clovia was launched in 2013 by Pankaj Vermani, Neha Kant and Suman Chowdhury.

292.title: Israeli PM Naftali Bennett to make his 1st visit to India on April 2
292.article_body: Israeli PM Naftali Bennett will arrive in India on his first official visit on April 2, according to a statement from his office. Bennett's visit comes on the occasion of the 30th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between the two countries. "This visit will reaffirm the important connection between the countries," the statement read.

293.title: Taiwan reports 121 new COVID-19 cases, zero deaths in last 24 hours
293.article_body: Taiwan on Sunday logged 121 new COVID-19 cases and zero deaths in last 24 hours. As per Taiwan's Central Epidemic Command Center (CECC), out of 121 new cases, 118 were imported cases and three were locally transmitted infections. Out of the new local infections, two were connected to a cluster in Chiayi and third was reported in Tainan, added CECC.

294.title: Was rejected several times due to women investors' absence: Nykaa Fashion CEO
294.article_body: Nykaa Fashion CEO Adwaita Nayar said she and Co-founder Falguni Nayar were rejected by several investors as they didn't have women in decision-making positions. "All of them said no-no, we're not interested. The same investors who are now super interested," Nayar said. She added that if women don't hold key positions, it becomes difficult for investors to understand women-centric businesses.

295.title: At least 902 civilians killed, 1,459 injured in Ukraine: UN
295.article_body: Office of UN High Commissioner for Human Rights (OHCHR) on Sunday said at least 902 civilians were killed in Ukraine since Russia invaded Ukraine on February 24. UN human rights office added that 1,459 residents were injured in Ukraine so far. The office added that most of the fatalities were from heavy artillery shelling, multiple-launch rocket systems, missiles and airstrikes.

296.title: Will ensure stability: Nirmala on Biren Singh being Manipur CM again
296.article_body: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Sunday termed the unanimous election of N Biren Singh as Manipur's CM for a second term a "good decision". "It'll ensure that Manipur has a stable and responsible government," she added. Singh was elected as CM in BJP's legislature party meeting in Imphal, 10 days after BJP won 32 Assembly seats in Manipur elections.

297.title: BSF seizes ancient idol meant to be smuggled to Bangladesh, 1 held
297.article_body: A person was apprehended by the BSF in West Bengal's Dakshin Dinajpur district on Sunday for illegally possessing a 12-centimetre-tall ancient metallic sculpture of Lord Ganesha. According to BSF officials, the person, who is an Indian national, was planning to smuggle the sculpture to Bangladesh. The accused has been handed over to the police for further action, officials added.

298.title: Disclose information of 360 US-controlled labs across world: Russia
298.article_body: Russia has said that it supports China's demand asking the US to disclose information about activities of 360 American-controlled labs in the world. China had made the demand at the United Nations Security Council (UNSC). Separately, Russia said it has discovered new details indicating that components of biological weapons were being developed in Ukraine.

299.title: Patriot air defence system start arriving in Slovakia from NATO partners
299.article_body: Slovakia on Sunday said the Patriot air defence system have started arriving in the country from its NATO partners and its deployment will continue in the coming days. Russia’s invasion of Ukraine has prompted NATO to boost its defences. The Patriot is a long-range system capable of automatically detecting and intercepting an aircraft within a radius of over 100 kilometres.

300.title: New colours, same commitment: LSG skipper KL Rahul practices for IPL
300.article_body: Lucknow Super Giants skipper KL Rahul took to Twitter to share pictures of him practising in the nets ahead of the upcoming season of IPL. "New colours, same commitment," he wrote. The 29-year-old, who earlier represented PBKS, was bought by LSG for ₹17 crore before IPL mega auction 2022. With 626 runs, Rahul was top-scorer for PBKS in IPL 2021.

301.title: I'm highly hopeful of performing: Babar on playing first-ever Test in Lahore
301.article_body: Ahead of third Pakistan-Australia Test, Pakistan captain Babar Azam said he's "highly" hopeful of performing in his first-ever Test at his home-ground in Lahore. He added that he can't explain the feeling of playing in front of the home crowd. The 27-year-old played his highest Test innings (425-ball 196) in last match in Karachi. The Test will begin on Monday.

302.title: I salute India today, it always maintains an independent foreign policy: Pak PM
302.article_body: Pakistan PM Imran Khan has praised India's foreign policy and said that it's 'better than that of Pakistan'. "I salute India today. It has always maintained an independent foreign policy," said Khan. "India is importing oil from Russia which is facing sanctions. This is because India's foreign policy is for the betterment of its people," he further said.

303.title: AIUDF to back Congress' Ripun Bora in Rajya Sabha biennial polls
303.article_body: All India United Democratic Front (AIUDF) will back Congress' Ripun Bora in upcoming Rajya Sabha biennial elections, AIUDF's leader Aminul Islam has said. "We went to Delhi, where we had a meeting with Congress high command...Sonia Gandhi requested AIUDF chief...to support [Bora]...We agreed," he added. Congress has named Ripun Bora as its candidate from Assam for elections on March 31.

304.title: Abhishek Banerjee to appear before ED in coal scam case tomorrow
304.article_body: TMC MP Abhishek Banerjee will appear before ED in Delhi in the coal scam case on Monday. At the Kolkata airport, he said, "BJP government is taking on TMC by using Central agencies. We've defeated them and they cannot digest this." He added, "I'm ready to bow down before the power of people but not before the people in power."

305.title: Pakistan logs 375 new COVID-19 cases, 1 death in last 24 hours
305.article_body: Pakistani authorities on Sunday said the country reported 375 new daily COVID-19 cases in last 24 hours taking the overall caseload to over 15 lakh. As per Pakistan's National Command and Operation Centre (NCOC), one new death was recorded taking the total death toll to 30,329. Meanwhile, Sindh province remains the country's worst-hit region with over 5,70,000 cases so far.

306.title: Rajasthan government proposes Right to Health Care Bill
306.article_body: Rajasthan government has proposed the Right to Health Care Bill and sought suggestions on its draft till March 24. Under the Bill, denial of health care services at any health care facility will invite a fine of up to ₹10,000. It will also ensure free treatment in government hospitals and in private hospitals established through land allocation on concessional rates.

307.title: US plans to resume oil, gas development on federal lands
307.article_body: US government on Friday said it plans to resume oil and gas development on federal lands. This comes after a court order allowed the government to continue imposing the value of around $50 per ton of greenhouse gases emitted. "With this ruling, the department continues its planning for responsible oil and gas development..." said US Interior Department spokesperson Melissa Schwartz.

308.title: Pope Francis visits Ukrainian children war refugees in Rome's hospital
308.article_body: Pope Francis on Saturday visited Ukrainian children war refugees being treated in a paediatric hospital in Rome. As per the Vatican, 19 Ukrainian children are currently being treated for cancer, neurological conditions or serious war injuries caused by explosions. "The blood and tears of children, the suffering of women, men who are defending their land... shakes our conscience," Francis said.

309.title: 20-yr-old woman raped inside public toilet near railway station in UP
309.article_body: A 20-year-old woman was allegedly raped inside a public toilet located near a parking stand at Uttar Pradesh’s Pratapgarh railway station. As per the police, the woman was waiting for a train with her husband at the platform. While she looked for a washroom, the accused gave her access to a clean washroom and raped her there, police added.

310.title: Study proposes moon's orbit as gravitational wave detector
310.article_body: An international team of researchers proposed that a natural gravitational wave detector exists in the Earth-Moon system. They stated that gravitational waves that constantly hit the system produce tiny deviations in Moon's orbit that are measured in the microhertz frequency range. The scientists used this range to propose a new form of studying gravitational waves emitted by the distant universe.

311.title: IFS officer shares pic of sign dedicated to sparrow killed in police firing in Guj
311.article_body: IFS officer Parveen Kaswan on Sunday shared a picture of a plaque dedicated to a sparrow that was killed in police firing in March 1974 in Gujarat's Ahmedabad. The picture, shared on the occasion of World Sparrow Day, went viral. As per Kaswan, this is the only plaque in the world dedicated to a sparrow, adding, "People are beautiful".

312.title: 2 die waiting in line to buy fuel in Sri Lanka amid economic crisis
312.article_body: Two men collapsed and died in Sri Lanka while waiting in separate queues to buy fuel amid a widespread shortage caused by an economic crisis in the country. "One was a 70-year-old three-wheeler driver...while the second was a 72-year-old," the Sri Lankan Police said on Sunday. "Both had been waiting in line for about four hours," they added.

313.title: Amazon HQ construction on sacred land halted by South African court
313.article_body: The construction of Amazon's new headquarters in South Africa has been halted by a court after the descendants of the country's earliest inhabitants said the land it would be built on is sacred. "This matter ultimately concerns the rights of indigenous peoples," the judge said. Earlier, activists urged Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos' ex-wife MacKenzie Scott to help block the construction.

314.title: Decision on swearing-in of Goa CM to be taken tomorrow: Sawant
314.article_body: Goa caretaker CM Pramod Sawant said the decision about the swearing-in ceremony of the next CM will be taken during a legislature party meeting on Monday. Sawant and his party colleague Vishwajit Rane met Union Home Minister Amit Shah in Delhi on Saturday. Union Ministers Narendra Singh Tomar and L Murugan are observers to oversee government formation in the state.

315.title: Hyd Police inaugurate 30 CCTV cameras in Vikas Nagar colony
315.article_body: Hyderabad Police has inaugurated 30 CCTV cameras at Vikas Nagar colony. The news was announced on the official Twitter handle of Rachakonda Police with pictures that showed police officials holding the CCTV opening ceremony in the area. The post read the cameras were inaugurated with the help of the colony association, Municipal Chairman Chandra Reddy and others.

316.title: B'luru park's recharge wells expected to tackle city's water crisis
316.article_body: Recharge wells at Bengaluru's Cubbon Park are expected to tackle the city's water crisis. The park's decades-old seven open wells were de-silted and cleaned after being left unused and neglected. The wells now provide the park over a lakh litre of water daily, with 73 rainwater recharge wells dug up to ensure they never run out of water.

317.title: PMC organises photography & video shooting training for urban poor
317.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation and the Social Development Department have launched an initiative to provide photography and video shooting training to the urban poor living in the Pune municipal area. The initiative will provide both basic and advanced training for a period of six months. The initiative is for people in the age group of 15-45.

318.title: BMC removes 782 abandoned vehicles from Mumbai roads
318.article_body: The BMC removed 782 abandoned vehicles from Mumbai roads last week and issued notices to 2,381 vehicle owners to remove their vehicles from roads in 24 administrative wards. The vehicles which aren't removed by owners will be seized and auctioned, officials said. This comes after Mumbai Police Commissioner held a joint meeting with BMC and police officials regarding abandoned vehicles.

319.title: Russia & Ukraine nearing agreement on 'critical' issues: Turkey
319.article_body: Turkish Foreign Minister Mevlüt Çavuşoğlu has said that Russia and Ukraine were nearing an agreement on "critical" issues. Çavuşoğlu added that he was hopeful for a ceasefire in the war if both countries don't backtrack on talks. The countries were getting closer on issues, including renouncing Ukraine's NATO ambitions and demilitarisation, Al Jazeera quoted a Turkish official as saying.

320.title: Mumbai Police arrest man for kidnapping & marrying 15-yr-old girl
320.article_body: Mumbai Police have arrested a 21-year-old man who allegedly kidnapped and illegally married a 15-year-old girl in Shirdi. According to a report, the girl had failed to return home after appearing for her class 10 exam following which her parents lodged a missing complaint. She was sent for a hospital check-up by police after she returned the next day.

321.title: Man arrested in B'luru for smuggling guns, revolvers from Maha
321.article_body: A 29-year-old man has been arrested by the Bengaluru Police for allegedly smuggling guns and revolvers from Maharashtra and selling them at higher prices in the city. Police said they have seized two pistols and four live bullets from his possession. The man had cases pending against him for smuggling weapons, the police further said.

322.title: Delhi driver fakes robbery to steal ₹20 lakh to please girlfriends
322.article_body: A 24-year-old driver was arrested for planning a fake robbery to steal ₹20 lakh from his employer to please his girlfriends, in Delhi's Civil Lines, police said. Sushil Aggarwal (52), on Wednesday, had sent the driver with the cash. However, the accused claimed to have been robbed while changing the car's tyre, said DCP (north) Sagar Singh Kalsi.

323.title: 22-yr-old man killed during fight over loud music on Holi in Delhi
323.article_body: A 22-year-old man was allegedly stabbed to death and his 20-year-old brother was injured by six men, who attacked the two over playing loud music in Delhi's Punjabi Bagh area, police said. Deputy Commissioner of Police (west) Ghanshyam Bansal said that Manoj (22) was "declared brought dead by the doctors, whereas his brother received five stitches on his scalp."

324.title: Female theatre artist attacked with acid in Bengaluru; 3 arrested
324.article_body: A female theatre artist from Bengaluru was attacked with acid on March 18 by three of her theatre colleagues. The accused, identified as Ramesh, Swati and Yogesh, poured acid on the victim thrice while she was lying down on her verandah. The accused said they attacked the victim as Ramesh's wife and children left him because of her.

325.title: EWS admission process in schools in Delhi to begin on March 29
325.article_body: The online application process to get seats in Delhi's private schools under the economically weaker section (EWS)/disadvantaged groups (DG) and children with special needs (CWSN) categories for 2022-2023 will begin on March 29. Applications for these seats were supposed to begin online from March 22, according to the earlier schedule issued by the Directorate of Education.

326.title: I was nervous playing against Nadal: Alcaraz on semi-final loss
326.article_body: Carlos Alcaraz, speaking about his semi-final loss against Rafael Nadal at the Indian Wells, said that he was nervous during the match. "In the whole match, I was thinking...I'm playing against Nadal," Alcaraz stated. He further said, "The next time I will play more calmly and more relaxed. If you are playing against [Nadal], you have to be calm."

327.title: 4 illegal brick kilns shut down in Gautam Buddha Nagar
327.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh Pollution Control Board (UPPCB) has shut down four brick kilns operating illegally in Gautam Buddha Nagar's Jewar this week. The kilns had started operating again after being shut down in 2020, an official said. "Our team reached the spot and poured water in them in a bid to stop them from operating illegally," the official added.

328.title: Treated Indian Wells semis vs Alcaraz like playing vs a top-8 player: Nadal
328.article_body: Following his semi-final win against world number 19 Carlos Alcaraz in Indian Wells, 21-time Grand Slam champion Rafael Nadal said it was a "good match". He added, "I didn't treat the match like I was facing a young player at all, but rather like I was playing against a top-eight player." Nadal beat 18-year-old Alcaraz 6-4, 4-6, 6-3 on Saturday.

329.title: CISF to install body scanners at airports in Mumbai, Delhi & other cities
329.article_body: The Central Industrial Security Force (CISF) will install body scanners at major airports in the country, including Delhi and Mumbai. A trial run of body scanners was conducted at several airports, including Delhi, Bangalore, Cochin, Hyderabad, Pune and Chennai, but they observed some shortcomings, officials said. The CISF has decided to adopt the millimetre wave technology, officials added.

330.title: Hope it's start of something amazing: Pooran on joining SRH ahead of IPL
330.article_body: On joining SRH's squad ahead of upcoming IPL 2022, wicketkeeper-batter Nicholas Pooran, who was bought by the franchise for ₹10.75 crore, said he hopes it's the start of something amazing. "I've had a chat with the coaches and Brian Lara [head coach] a bit...he (Brian) is one of the best batsmen in the world that I've ever seen," he added.

331.title: Witness in Dabholkar murder case identifies 2 shooters in Pune court
331.article_body: An eye-witness in the Narendra Dabholkar murder case on Saturday identified two alleged shooters in a Pune court that is overseeing the trial, an official said. Kiran Kamble, after finishing work, heard a "sound like a firecracker burst," said Public Prosecutor Prakash Suryavanshi. When he looked in the direction from where the sound came, he saw two people shoot someone.

332.title: Condom sales surge in Russia amid Western sanctions & fear of shortage
332.article_body: Amid Western sanctions and fear of shortage, sales for condoms have surged in Russia. The country’s largest online retailer Wildberries saw condom sales surging 170% in the first two weeks of March as compared with last year. Pharmacy chain 36.6 also reported a 26% jump in its sales. Meanwhile, a government official said a shortage of this product isn't expected.

333.title: Cooperating with authorities: Infra.Market after ₹224 cr undisclosed income detected
333.article_body: Infra.Market Founder Souvik Sengupta on Sunday said that they are cooperating with the authorities to provide them with the necessary information to solve the issues they have in relation to the recent searches. The Income Tax department has found an undisclosed income of ₹224 crore from the Maharashtra-based unicorn startup group and has seized unaccounted cash worth ₹1 crore.

334.title: Rachakonda Police bust prostitution racket, detain 2 under PD Act
334.article_body: Rachakonda Police invoked the Preventive Detention (PD) Act on Saturday against two offenders for allegedly running a prostitution racket in Hyderabad's Shivaji Nagar area. The accused, identified as Vanarula Sai Kishore and Vanarula Bhavani, were caught along with four others following a raid on Tuesday. Three women, who hailed from Andhra Pradesh, were also rescued from the premises.

335.title: Drunk man calls police 6 times to complain about wife not cooking mutton in T'gana
335.article_body: A man in Telangana dialled 100 six times on Holi to complain about his wife refusing to cook mutton after which he was arrested, police said. Naveen of Cherla Gowraram village in Kanagal made the calls after getting drunk. Police initially dismissed his calls as a prank but decided to take action after repeated calls from Naveen.

336.title: It's gut-wrenching: NZ's Amy Satterthwaite on one-wicket loss vs Eng
336.article_body: Talking about New Zealand's one-wicket loss to England in the Women's ODI World Cup, New Zealand's Amy Satterthwaite said, "It's pretty gut-wrenching to get that close...and feel like you're standing on the edge of the cliff." "It's never...nice position to be in when you're relying on other results...today, we felt like we still had it in our control," she added.

337.title: He's in form at the moment: KKR's Cummins on captain Shreyas ahead of IPL
337.article_body: Talking about KKR captain Shreyas Iyer, teammate Pat Cummins said he's a calm guy and seems "in form" at the moment. Cummins recalled sharing the dressing room with Shreyas during IPL 2017. "Shreyas, I played with at Delhi (Daredevils), we got on really well," he added. Cummins was bought back by KKR for ₹7.25 crore at IPL mega auction 2022.

338.title: N Korea fires multiple rocket launcher shots into sea: S Korea
338.article_body: North Korea has fired multiple rocket launcher shots into the sea on Sunday, South Korea's Joint Chiefs of Staff said in a statement. "Our military was monitoring the related situation and maintaining a readiness posture," it added. Notably, this comes amid heightened military tensions after a spate of missile launches by North Korea since January.

339.title: Man beaten to death for not giving money to buy liquor in Mumbai
339.article_body: Eight people have been arrested for allegedly killing a man in Mumbai's Versova after he refused to give them money for liquor. The victim was on the way to his home when a person, who knew him, along with his colleagues stopped him and demanded money. A heated argument broke out and the accused hit him with bamboo sticks.

340.title: Covishield dose gap can be reduced to 8-16 weeks from 12-16 weeks: Expert body
340.article_body: India's top expert body on immunisation NTAGI has recommended reducing the gap between the first and second Covishield vaccine doses to between eight and 16 weeks, as per reports. Currently, the second vaccine dose is administered between 12 and 16 weeks after the first. No change has been suggested in the dose gap of Covaxin, PTI reported.

341.title: Bengaluru pitch used for India-Sri Lanka Test rated below average by ICC, venue penalised
341.article_body: The pitch used for India-Sri Lanka Day-Night Test at M Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru has been rated below average by ICC. Consequently, the venue has received one demerit point. ICC match referee Javagal Srinath said, "Pitch offered a lot of turn on first day itself and though it improved with every session...it wasn't an even contest between bat and ball."

342.title: Nadal beats 18-yr-old compatriot Alcaraz to enter Indian Wells final
342.article_body: Rafael Nadal defeated 18-year-old Carlos Alcaraz 6-4, 4-6, 6-3 in the all-Spanish clash to enter the singles final of the Indian Wells. Praising the 19th ranked player's performance, Nadal said, "It was just so difficult to stop him (Alcaraz) with his amazing shots." The 35-year-old Spaniard will meet US' Taylor Fritz in his fifth Indian Wells final on Sunday.

343.title: Merger of LJD with RJD was demand of people: Tejashwi Yadav
343.article_body: Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) leader Tejashwi Yadav welcomed the move of Sharad Yadav-led Loktantrik Janata Dal (LJD) to merge with his party on Sunday. The Bihar Assembly's Leader of Opposition said, "The decision (merging of LJD into RJD) taken by Sharad Yadav was the demand of the people." Tejashwi also made calls for a united opposition front to defeat BJP.

344.title: Pics show people playing drum on open truck on Mumbai-Pune expressway
344.article_body: Pictures surfaced online show a group of people playing a drum on an open truck on the Mumbai-Pune expressway. The men were seen standing on the truck, which was also carrying two-wheelers. People reacted to the pictures on Twitter. "Goods carrier has become a public carrier, it seems!" a user wrote.

345.title: Yemen's Houthis fire drone, missiles at Saudi facilities, none hurt
345.article_body: Yemen's Houthi rebels on Sunday launched multiple drone and missile strikes on key facilities including natural gas and desalination plants in Saudi Arabia, reported Saudi's state-run media. The attacks did not cause casualties or injuries but damaged civilian vehicles and homes. As per Saudi-led military coalition, strikes also targeted an Aramco oil facility in Jizan along with other facilities.

346.title: Apple ex-employee charged with defrauding company out of $10 mn in US
346.article_body: Dhirendra Prasad, a former Apple employee, has been charged with defrauding the tech giant out of more than $10 million in the US. The 52-year-old worked for 10 years as a buyer in Apple's Global Service Supply Chain department. According to the federal prosecutors, Prasad exploited his position to defraud Apple by allegedly taking kickbacks, stealing equipment and laundering money.

347.title: 8,500 chicken charred to death as fire breaks out at poultry farm in Tamil Nadu
347.article_body: Around 8,500 chicken and chicks were charred in a fire that broke out at a poultry farm in Tamil Nadu's Annur, police said on Sunday. It took the fire and rescue service personnel two hours to extinguish the blaze. Some equipment and poultry feed also got burnt in the fire, resulting in an estimated loss of ₹12 lakh, police added.

348.title: Putin wears Italian jacket worth ₹10 lakh at a rally amid Western sanctions
