348.article_body: Amid sanctions by the West, Russian President Vladimir Putin wore a blue jacket made by an Italian brand, Loro Piana, priced at 1.5 million roubles (over ₹10 lakh), at a rally while justifying the Ukraine war. As per a report, in 2021, the average Russian's annual salary was 678,000 roubles, less than half the cost of Putin's jacket.

349.title: Thought Ronaldo would stay in the club: Juventus CEO Arrivabene
349.article_body: Recalling Cristiano Ronaldo's transfer in 2021, Juventus CEO Maurizio Arrivabene has said that he thought the Portuguese footballer would stay in the club. "I saw a motivated Ronaldo on the first days of the pre-season...but then he took a different decision and we know what happened," he added. Ronaldo joined Premier League club Manchester United last year.

350.title: No governance in Bihar but circus without ringmaster: Manoj Jha
350.article_body: RJD leader Manoj Kumar Jha said there is no governance in Bihar but a "circus" and that too without a "ringmaster". The people of Bihar are suffering in the ongoing circus, he added. Jha alleged that the Bihar government has lost credibility amongst the people and the administrative officers are not under the control of the government.

351.title: Elephant tramples 10-yr-old girl to death in Chhattisgarh; 3 escape
351.article_body: A 10-year-old girl was trampled to death by a wild elephant, while three other children managed to escape in Chhattisgarh's Bilaspur on Sunday, officials said. The children had gone to pick flowers when the incident occurred, a forest officer said. Forest officials had warned villagers about a herd of elephants, but the children had ignored the warning, the officer added.

352.title: Hyd Police apprehend 3 for drug smuggling, use; seize LSD blots
352.article_body: Three people, including two drug peddlers, were apprehended by Hyderabad's Banjara Hills Police, police said on Saturday. Police caught peddlers while they were supplying narcotics to a person at a city hotel after receiving a tip-off. A total of four lysergic acid diethylamide (LSD) blots, sourced from Goa, and phones, all worth ₹16,000 were seized from accused, police added.

353.title: Seven humanitarian corridors would open on Sunday: Ukraine Deputy PM
353.article_body: Ukrainian Deputy PM Iryna Vereshchuk said seven humanitarian corridors to enable civilians to leave frontline regions would open on Sunday, March 20. Ukraine has evacuated 190,000 people from such areas since the Russian invasion began on February 24, added Vereshchuk. Meanwhile, UN said at least 847 civilians were killed from February 24 to March 18.

354.title: N Biren Singh to be Chief Minister of Manipur for 2nd time: BJP
354.article_body: N Biren Singh is going to be the Chief Minister of Manipur for the second time, the BJP announced on Sunday. Singh was unanimously elected as the CM in the Manipur BJP legislature party meeting in Imphal. BJP's announcement comes 10 days after the party won 32 out of 60 Assembly seats in Manipur.

355.title: I love to see 150 kmph being clocked on the big screen: Meredith
355.article_body: Australia fast bowler Riley Meredith, in an introduction video posted by Mumbai Indians' official YouTube channel, said, "I love to see 150 kmph being clocked on the big screen." Meredith stated that bouncer is his favorite delivery. The 25-year-old, who previously played for Punjab Kings, was bought by Mumbai Indians in the IPL 2022 mega auction for ₹1 crore.

356.title: There's big potential in RR to win the IPL 2022: Shimron Hetmyer
356.article_body: Rajasthan Royals batter Shimron Hetmyer opined that his franchise has the potential to win the IPL this year. Hetmyer, who has previously played for Delhi Capitals, was bought by Rajasthan Royals for ₹8.5 crore in the mega auction. "There's no pressure of the price tag on me, it's a challenge to help the Royals when I'm out there," he added.

357.title: Microbes, minerals may have set off Earth's oxygenation: US study
357.article_body: US researchers stated that microbes and minerals may have triggered Earth's oxygenation. The team proposed a hypothesis which suggested that oxygen started accumulating in the atmosphere due to interaction between some marine microbes and minerals that are found in ocean sediments. Scientists added that these interactions prevented oxygen from being consumed setting off a self-amplifying process.

358.title: ISRO plans to increase number of launches, satellite manufacturing
358.article_body: ISRO Chairman S Somanath said the agency plans to increase the number of launches and satellite manufacturing. "ISRO is looking at the important tasks that can be done this year..." added Somanath. According to him, ISRO will look at increasing space missions with the Polar Satellite Launch Vehicle (PSLV), Geosynchronous Satellite Launch Vehicle (GSLV) and Small Satellite Launch Vehicle (SSLV).

359.title: Suzuki to invest ₹10,440 cr to make electric vehicles, batteries in Gujarat
359.article_body: Japan's Suzuki Motor Corporation has announced plans to invest around ₹10,440 crore to locally manufacture electric vehicles (BEV) and BEV batteries in Gujarat. The memorandum of understanding was signed at India-Japan Economic Forum in the presence of PM Narendra Modi and Japanese PM Fumio Kishida. "We'll continue active investment in India to realise Atmanirbhar Bharat," Suzuki's President said.

360.title: Man catches 10.5-ft-long 'living dinosaur' fish said to be over 100 yrs old in Canada
360.article_body: A fisherman caught a 10.5-foot-long sturgeon fish, also known as the 'living dinosaur', in a river in Canada's British Columbia. A now-viral video has shown fisherman Yves Bisson releasing the giant fish weighing over 500 pounds (over 226 kg) back into the river after tagging it. Bisson said the fish could be over 100 years old.

361.title: Dad didn't teach me acting; never brought things related to films at home: Ram
361.article_body: Actor Ram Charan revealed that even though he hails from a film family, nothing related to movies was brought home during his childhood. "It was always confined to office. There was no trace of films for me," he said. Ram further added that even when he was starting off his career, his father Chiranjeevi never told him how to act.

362.title: Had to create sane lunatic to compete with mad hero: Ethan on Moon Knight
362.article_body: Actor Ethan Hawke, who stars opposite Oscar Isaac as villain Arthur Harrow in the upcoming Marvel show 'Moon Knight', has said he had to "create a very sane lunatic to compete with the mad hero". "In our story, hero is struggling with mental illness and it created a real problem for me because...antagonist has to be something else," he added.

363.title: Spinners need to learn to perform in all conditions: Saeed Ajmal
363.article_body: Talking about flat pitches used in Rawalpindi and Karachi in the first two Pakistan-Australia Tests, ex-Pakistan spinner Saeed Ajmal said spinners need to learn to perform in all conditions. "If you want to complain about 'flat pitches'...you should quit cricket," he added. This comes as Pakistan spinner Nauman Ali is the leading wicket-taker in the ongoing series with seven wickets.

364.title: Police should give security for matches after recovering dues from MCA: Activist
364.article_body: An RTI activist, Anil Galgali, has written to Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey urging him to provide security for cricket matches only after recovering dues from the Mumbai Cricket Association (MCA). Galgali alleged that the MCA has not paid dues worth ₹14.82 crore to the Mumbai Police in the past eight years even after receiving 35 reminders of recovery.

365.title: B'luru Police share road safety post, say 'Helmet, belts will keep safe'
365.article_body: Bengaluru Police took to Twitter to share a post on road safety. "Seat belts and helmets are mandatory when you are driving, which will keep you safe. Be responsible and follow the road safety rules and model for minors," the tweet read. The post also showed a graphic presentation of using seat belts and helmets.

366.title: BJP's Kirit Somaiya alleges ₹1,000 cr scam by Shiv Sena leaders in Mumbai
366.article_body: BJP leader Kirit Somaiya claimed of exposing ₹1,000 crore scam alleging that Shiv Sena leader Yashwant Jadhav and his wife, an MLA, Yamini Yashwant bought 36 old buildings in Mumbai in the past two years. "₹1,000 crore scam exposed, I am confident of actions by ED, Company Ministry, Income Tax Department in next few days," the BJP leader tweeted.

367.title: What's the controversy around release of 'The Kashmir Files' in New Zealand?
367.article_body: The release of 'The Kashmir Files' has been put on hold in New Zealand after its censor board decided to review the movie's classification. This came after members of the Muslim community in New Zealand raised concerns about the film, which was earlier cleared for audiences above the age of 16. The community alleged the movie could raise 'anti-Muslim sentiments'.

368.title: Showing 'The Kashmir...' for free in park is criminal offence: Vivek on Haryana poster
368.article_body: Director Vivek Agnihotri took to Twitter to share a poster from Haryana's Rewari wherein BJP leaders invited people for free screening of 'The Kashmir Files' in a park. Vivek wrote, "Showing 'The Kashmir Files' like this in open and free is a criminal offence. Dear @mlkhattar ji...I’d request you to stop this." He added, "Political leaders must respect creative business."

369.title: Couldn't find financer; considered releasing 'The Kashmir...' on YouTube: Vivek
369.article_body: Recently at a press conference, director Vivek Agnihotri spoke about the hurdles he faced before starting the shooting of 'The Kashmir Files'. He said, "Film begins with an idea...But in our case, there was no material." "Another problem was to find a financer. We hadn't even thought that we'd make a feature film...We had...considered releasing it on YouTube," he said.

370.title: Rubina is more successful, she's doing more work than I am: Abhinav
370.article_body: Actor Abhinav Shukla said in an interview that his actress-wife Rubina Dilaik is a bigger star than him. "I know she's more successful than me...She's doing more work than I am, that's a fact," he added. "We've to be practical about it. It is what it is...Somebody would be a fool who doesn't admit she's more successful," Abhinav further said.

371.title: Excited to work with Sangakkara, Malinga and Boult: RR's Saini
371.article_body: Pacer Navdeep Saini, who was bought by RR for ₹2.6 crore in the IPL mega auction, has said he's excited to work with Kumar Sangakkara and Lasith Malinga and play alongside Trent Boult in the upcoming season. "I'm coming into this season on the back of a lot of hard work," he stated. Saini played only two matches last season.

372.title: AC Milan players racially abused by crowd: Manager Stefano Pioli
372.article_body: AC Milan goalkeeper Mike Maignan and defender Fikayo Tomori were racially abused by Cagliari club supporters during their 1-0 Serie A win on Saturday, manager Stefano Pioli said. "Mike told me it was possible to hear some insults from behind the goal...Tomori also told me the same thing," Pioli added. However, Cagliari's Joao Pedro denied hearing any racist comments.

373.title: Very important day: Karthik on 8-ball 29* in 2018 Nidahas Trophy final
373.article_body: Recalling his match-winning knock of 8-ball 29* in 2018 Nidahas Trophy final against Bangladesh, India wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik said, "It's a very important day in my life." He added, "Two overs and 34 runs- as a batter you're thinking 'how many boundaries can I hit?'" With five needed off final delivery, he hit a six. India won by four wickets.

374.title: 6 killed, dozens injured as car rams into carnival crowd in Belgium
374.article_body: At least six people, including a child, were killed and over 30 were injured after a car rammed into a crowd that had gathered to attend a carnival in Belgium's Strepy-Bracquegnies. "The driver was intercepted as he tried to get away," said the mayor of the neighbouring town La Louviere. It was not immediately known if the incident was intentional.

375.title: Australia to provide temporary visas to refugees from Ukraine
375.article_body: Australia will issue temporary humanitarian visas to refugees from Ukraine, enabling them to study, work and access medicare in the country for up to three years, Australian government has said. About 4,500 visas have been issued to Ukrainians since the Russian invasion, it added. Additionally, the government has provided a grant of AUD$ 450,000 to local communities to assist refugees.

376.title: US pair of Jack Sock, John Isner win men's doubles title at Indian Wells
376.article_body: The American pair of Jack Sock and John Isner won the men's doubles title at the Indian Wells on Saturday. The pair defeated Santiago Gonzalez and Edouard Roger-Vasselin in straight sets 7-6(7-4), 6-3. Notably, the women's doubles title was won by the Chinese pair of Xu Yifan and Yang Zhaoxuan who also defeated their opponents in straight sets.

377.title: Ukrainian woman saves one-month-old daughter from shelling, pic from hospital goes viral
377.article_body: A woman in Ukraine saved her one-month-old daughter from Russian shelling by covering the baby with her body. The woman herself received numerous injuries after which she was taken to the Okhmatdyt Children's Hospital. A picture of the woman with her daughter from the hospital has gone viral on social media.

378.title: Ajith to team up with Vignesh Shivan for his next, film to release in 2023
378.article_body: Ajith Kumar is set to collaborate with filmmaker Vignesh Shivan for his next film, which has been tentatively titled 'AK 62'. The upcoming project will be bankrolled by Lyca Productions. "The shooting of the film will commence by the end of this year and release by mid next year. The other...details will be announced soon," Lyca said in a statement.

379.title: Mahatma Gandhi biggest Hindu and secularist: Ghulam Nabi Azad
379.article_body: Senior Congress leader Ghulam Nabi Azad on Sunday hailed Mahatma Gandhi as the "biggest Hindu and secularist". Speaking at an event in Jammu, Azad further said that political parties, be it regional or national, divide people on the basis of religion, caste and other things. "Justice must be given to everyone irrespective of caste and religion," he added.

380.title: Man carrying ₹25,000 bounty arrested in Noida's Sector 62
380.article_body: A man carrying a ₹25,000 bounty for his alleged involvement in smuggling of cow meat has been arrested in Noida's Sector 62 after a firefight with the police on Thursday. "We recovered from his possession a bag that contained tools used to slaughter animals," a police officer said. A country-made pistol and four live cartridges were also recovered, he added.

381.title: It's not about wickets, it about how you play: Akhtar recalls chat with Warne
381.article_body: Ex-Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar has said he once asked Shane Warne if his career would be defined by the number of wickets he has taken. "Warne said, 'No Shoaib, people remember how you play the cricket...It's not how many wickets you've taken, it's the way you played the game'," recalled Akhtar. Warne died of a heart attack earlier this month.

382.title: Telangana's veteran CPI(M) leader Mallu Swarajyam passes away at 91
382.article_body: Telangana's veteran communist leader Mallu Swarajyam passed away due to multiple organ failures in Hyderabad on Saturday. The 91-year-old CPI(M) member participated in the Telangana People's Armed Struggle (1946-51) against feudal lords and Razakars during the Nizam rule. As a candidate of CPI(M), she was elected to the state Assembly of undivided Andhra Pradesh for two terms (1978 and 1983).

383.title: 3 Haryana women killed as jeep overturns while trying to save animal
383.article_body: At least three women were killed and 11 injured after the pickup jeep in which they were travelling overturned in Hisar district of Haryana on Saturday, police said. The accident occurred after a stray animal came in front of their jeep. The driver tried to avoid hitting the animal and lost control of the jeep.

384.title: Hoping B'wood doesn't make any more remakes; don't want to see more: Ananya
384.article_body: In a recent interview, actress Ananya Panday said that she hopes there aren't any more remakes in Bollywood. "I'm really happy with this. This path that we're going down is where we're kind of telling an original, braver, complex story," she added. "So, I'm kind of in that phase where I don't really want to see more remakes," Ananya said.

385.title: 45-yr-old man kills wife's lover in TN after learning about their affair; held
385.article_body: A 45-year-old man in Tamil Nadu's 15 Velampalayam allegedly killed his wife's lover after learning about their affair and following the murder, the accused was arrested by the police on Saturday. The deceased man was staying at a rented accommodation. His wife died a few years ago and he was staying along with his two sons, mother and younger brother.

386.title: Had an orgasm while watching Jaideep Ahlawat in Paatal Lok: Zeeshan Ayyub
386.article_body: In a recent interview, actor Mohammed Zeeshan Ayyub spoke about his favourite characters of his co-star Jaideep Ahlawat. Zeeshan said he almost had an "orgasm" after watching him in 'Paatal Lok'. When Jaideep was asked the same question, he said Zeeshan's character from 'Raanjhanaa' is his favourite. "I was in love with him in 'Raanjhanaa' as Pandit Ji," he added.

387.title: Labourers attacked with glass bottles for playing Bhojpuri music on Holi
387.article_body: A group of labourers from Bihar was allegedly attacked with glass bottles by a group of around eight to 10 youths at a factory in Haryana's Raipur Rani for playing Bhojpuri songs during a DJ party on Holi. One of the victims alleged that the accused told the DJ to play Punjabi music. Police have arrested two persons so far.

388.title: Portion of Ludhiana road caves in due to water leakage, area barricaded
388.article_body: A one-foot long portion of a road in Punjab's Ludhiana caved in on Saturday. Municipal Corporation officials said that there was leakage in one of the water supply connections due to which sand might have eroded leading to the road to cave in. Police installed a barricade around the damaged site. No accidents were reported.

389.title: Russia bombs Mariupol art school that was housing 400 residents: Ukraine
389.article_body: Russian forces on Saturday bombed an art school where around 400 residents were taking shelter, said Mariupol city council. As per the local authorities, the school’s building was destroyed and people could be under the rubble. As of now, there is no confirmation of casualties. Earlier, Russian forces bombed a theatre in Mariupol where civilians were sheltering.

390.title: Bee attack killed man in custody: Bihar Police after mob kills ASI, sets station on fire
390.article_body: After a mob allegedly set fire to a police station in Bihar and killed an assistant sub-inspector (ASI) over an alleged custodial death of a villager, Bettiah SP UN Verma claimed the man died after being attacked by bees. Verma said the incident took place when the deceased was drinking water from a hand pump on the police station premises.

391.title: Shane Warne given lap of honour at private funeral in Melbourne, pics surface
391.article_body: Shane Warne's family and friends bid the cricketing legend farewell at a private funeral in Melbourne on Sunday. Warne's three children and parents were joined by around 80 guests, including Michael Clarke and Michael Vaughan, at the service. Warne was given a lap of honour at St Kilda's home ground with Coldplay's 'Fix You' playing in the background.

392.title: Speeding auto overturns as youths throw water balloons at it in UP, video surfaces
392.article_body: An autorickshaw met with an accident after being struck by water balloons hurled at it by local youths in UP's Baghpat. A video of the incident shows the auto, that was moving at high speed, overturning after being hit by water balloons on Holi. At least two people along with the auto driver were injured in the incident.

393.title: World Bank to give ₹7 cr to build modernised slaughterhouse in Pune
393.article_body: The World Bank will give the Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) ₹7 crore to construct a modernised slaughterhouse in the city, officials have said. This project will help citizens in getting good quality meat and stop the illegal slaughter of animals, Municipal Commissioner Vikram Kumar said. A PMC Veterinary Officer said that the civic body-owned Kondhwa slaughterhouse will also be upgraded.

394.title: Jennifer Lopez, Affleck to buy estate with 10 bedrooms, 17 bathrooms for $50 million: Reports
394.article_body: Jennifer Lopez and Ben Affleck are buying an estate worth $50 million in the Bel-Air area of Los Angeles, as per reports. The estate is spread across 20,000 square feet and has 10 bedrooms, 17 bathrooms, multiple kitchens, a theatre and gym among other things, reports added. The house is super private, surrounded by trees, reports further said.

395.title: Poland begins issuing identification cards to Ukraine refugees
395.article_body: Over 1,23,000 personal identification number (PESEL) cards have been distributed to refugees from Ukraine in Poland since Wednesday, Polish authorities have confirmed. These cards will enable refugees to reside, study, work, avail medical and social benefits in Poland for the next 18 months. Poland has taken in over 2 million refugees from Ukraine since the Russian invasion last month.

396.title: We need to focus on what we need to get ready for 1st game: DC coach Ponting
396.article_body: DC head coach Ricky Ponting has said he's focusing on what they need to get ready for their match of IPL 2022. He added, "I had a great first session with the players. There's an energetic vibe around the team." Ponting further said, "I'm going to have breakfast, lunch and dinner with all the younger guys that I don't know."

397.title: Gurugram authorities to remove encroachments along 2.2-km long road
397.article_body: The Haryana Shehri Vikas Pradhikaran (HSVP) will carry out an anti-encroachment drive along a 2.2-kilometre long road between Hero Honda Chowk and Umang Bhardwaj Chowk in Gurugram from Monday. The drive is being carried out ahead of the expansion of the road in the area. The support of the police for demolishing the encroachments has been sought, the HSVP said.

398.title: Bengaluru Police arrests 2 from TN for threats to hijab case judges
398.article_body: Bengaluru Police has arrested two persons for allegedly issuing threats to the special bench judges of the Karnataka HC who upheld the hijab ban in the state's educational institutions. The arrests were made on Saturday night and the accused are office bearers of the Tamil Nadu Thowheed Jamath. The state has now announced 'Y' category security for the three judges.

399.title: Inspect sites in 1st half of working days: Delhi PWD to officials
399.article_body: Delhi's Public Works Department (PWD) has asked its officials to devote first half of all working days to site inspection to ensure construction projects are completed on time. PWD also asked officials to submit brief field inspection reports to the Superintending Engineer on a daily basis. Officials will have to submit on-site photographs to the Engineer-in-Chief every day, it added.

400.title: Kajol gets body-shamed by trolls for her outfit; fans react, 'Let her live'
400.article_body: Actress Kajol Devgan recently attended film producer Apoorva Mehta's 50th birthday in Mumbai. For the occasion, the actress wore a black bodycon dress, while many appreciated her choice, some trolls body-shamed her. A user commented on the video, "Omg is she pregnant?" Defending the actress, one of her fans wrote, "She's healthy and looks her age. Just let her live."
